section_list.name: HANDOVER REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the source NG-RAN node to the target NG-RAN node to request the preparation of resources for a handover.
Direction: source NG-RAN node ? target NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
├─Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference

9.1.1.1 Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference IE Semantics: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.3 Unsuccessful Operation If there is no response from the target NG-RAN node to the HANDOVER REQUEST message before timer TXnRELOCprep expires in the source NG-RAN node, the source NG-RAN node should cancel the Handover Preparation procedure towards the target NG-RAN node by initiating the Handover Cancel procedure with the appropriate value for the Cause IE. The source NG-RAN node shall ignore any HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE or HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE message received after the initiation of the Handover Cancel procedure and remove any reference and release any resources related to the concerned Xn UE-associated signalling.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)
9.1.1.1 Target Cell Global ID IE Semantics: Includes either an E-UTRA CGI or an NR CGI 9.2.3.25 Target Cell Global ID - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR CGI or an E-UTRA CGI.
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).
9.2.3.24 GUAMI - Section Description: This IE contains the Globally Unique AMF Identifier (GUAMI) as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation At reception of the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target NG-RAN node shall prepare the configuration of the AS security relation between the UE and the target NG-RAN node by using the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and the AS Security Information IE in the UE Context Information IE, as specified in TS 33.501 [28].

9.1.1.1 NG-C UE associated Signalling reference IE Semantics: Allocated at the AMF on the source NG-C connection. 9.2.3.26 AMF UE NGAP ID - Section Description: This IE is defined in TS 38.413 [5] and used to uniquely identify the UE association over the source side NG interface instance.
│  ├─Signalling TNL association address at source NG-C side

9.1.1.1 Signalling TNL association address at source NG-C side IE Semantics: This IE indicates the AMF’s IP address of the SCTP association used at the source NG-C interface instance. Note: If no UE TNLA binding exists at the source NG-RAN node, the source NG-RAN node indicates the TNL association address it would have selected if it would have had to create a UE TNLA binding. 9.2.3.31 CP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn control plane transport.
9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.

9.2.3.49 UE Security Capabilities - Section Description: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation At reception of the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target NG-RAN node shall prepare the configuration of the AS security relation between the UE and the target NG-RAN node by using the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and the AS Security Information IE in the UE Context Information IE, as specified in TS 33.501 [28].

9.2.3.49 NR Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, “first bit” – 128-NEA1, “second bit” – 128-NEA2, “third bit” – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

9.2.3.49 NR Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, “first bit” – 128-NIA1, “second bit” – 128-NIA2, “third bit” – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

9.2.3.49 E-UTRA Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0, “first bit” – 128-EEA1, “second bit” – 128-EEA2, “third bit” – 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

9.2.3.49 E-UTRA Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0, “first bit” – 128-EIA1, “second bit” – 128-EIA2, “third bit” – 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

9.2.3.50 AS Security Information - Section Description: The AS Security Information IE is used to generate the key material to be used for AS security with the UE. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation At reception of the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target NG-RAN node shall prepare the configuration of the AS security relation between the UE and the target NG-RAN node by using the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and the AS Security Information IE in the UE Context Information IE, as specified in TS 33.501 [28].
9.2.3.50 Key NG-RAN Star IE Semantics: KNG-RAN* defined in TS 33.501 [28].
9.2.3.50 Next Hop Chaining Count IE Semantics: Next Hop Chaining Count (NCC) defined in TS 33.501 [28]

9.2.3.23 Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority - Section Description: The Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE is used to define local configuration for RRM strategies such as camp priorities and control of inter-RAT/inter-frequency mobility in RRC_CONNECTED, as specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target NG-RAN node shall store this information and use it as defined in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and a subscription parameter provided by the AMF to the NG-RAN. 9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  ├─PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List

9.1.1.1 PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE Semantics: Similar to NG-C signalling, containing UL tunnel information per PDU Session Resource; and in addition, the source side QoS flow ( DRB mapping 9.2.1.1 PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List - Section Description: This IE contains PDU session resource related information used at UE context transfer between NG-RAN nodes. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each PDU session if the PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE is included in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target NG-RAN node shall store the received PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in the UE context and use it when enforcing traffic policing for Non-GBR QoS flows for the concerned UE as specified in TS 23.501 [7]. For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DL Forwarding IE set to "DL forwarding proposed" within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. For each PDU session that the target NG-RAN node decides to admit the data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node includes the PDU Session level DL data forwarding GTP-U Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resource Admitted Info IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. For each DRB for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DRB ID IE and the mapped QoS Flows List IE within the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE contained in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. The source NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB. If the target NG-RAN node decides to use the same DRB configuration and to map the same QoS flows as the source NG-RAN node, the target NG-RAN node includes the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Response DRB List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this DRB. For each PDU session, if the Additional UL NG-U UP TNL Information List IE is included in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target NG-RAN node may forward the UP transport layer information to the target S-NG-RAN node as the uplink termination point for the user plane data for this PDU session split in different tunnel.
│  │  └─PDU Session Resources To Be Setup Item
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.21 S-NSSAI - Section Description: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

9.2.1.1 PDU Session Resource Aggregate Maximum Bitrate IE Semantics: This IE shall be present when at least one Non-GBR QoS Flow has been setup. 9.2.3.69 PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per PDU session which is defined for the downlink and the uplink direction and is provided at the Handover Preparation procedure to the target NG-RAN node and at the Retrieve UE Context procedure to the new NG-RAN node as received by the 5GC, during dual connectivity related procedures to the to the S-NG-RAN node as decided by the M-NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.
│  │     │  ├─PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  │     │  └─PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  │     ├─UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF

9.2.1.1 UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF IE Semantics: UPF endpoint of the NG-U transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
│  │     ├─Additional UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF List
9.2.1.1 Additional UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF List IE Semantics: Additional UPF endpoint of the NG-U transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs

9.2.1.1 Source DL NG-U TNL Information IE Semantics: Indicates the possibility to keep the NG-U GTP-U tunnel termination point at the target NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.52 Security Indication - Section Description: This IE contains the user plane integrity protection indication and confidentiality protection indication which indicates the requirements on UP integrity protection and ciphering for the corresponding PDU session, respectively. Additionally, this IE contains the maximum integrity protected data rate values (UL and DL) per UE for integrity protected DRBs.
9.2.3.52 Integrity Protection Indication IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.
9.2.3.52 Confidentiality Protection Indication IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

9.2.3.52 - Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE - ifIntegrityProtectionrequiredorpreferred: This IE shall be present if the Integrity Protection IE within the Security Indication IE is present and set to “required” or “preferred”. 9.2.3.52 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: If present, this IE contains the values received from the CN for the overall UE capability. This IE may be ignored by the SN in the case of dual connectivity. 9.2.3.73 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in UL. If the Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE is absent, this IE applies to both UL and DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in the DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.
9.2.3.19 PDU Session Type - Section Description: This IE defines the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.1.1 Network Instance IE Semantics: This IE is ignored if the Common Network Instance IE is present. 9.2.3.85 Network Instance - Section Description: This IE provides the network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.5 QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be applied to a QoS flow.
9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.
9.2.3.8 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.5 GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
9.2.3.6 Notification Control IE Semantics: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.
9.2.3.5 Reflective QoS Attribute IE Semantics: Reflective QoS is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE applies to Non-GBR bearers only and is ignored otherwise.

9.2.3.5 Additional QoS flow Information IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "more likely", this indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise.
9.2.3.5 QoS Monitoring Request IE Semantics: Indicates to measure UL, or DL, or both UL/DL delays for the associated QoS flow.

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB ID IE included in the QoS Flow To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store the content of the IE in the UE context and use it for subsequent inter-system handover.
│  │     ├─Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node

9.2.1.17 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains information from a source NG-RAN node regarding per QoS flow proposed data forwarding and offloading. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DL Forwarding IE set to "DL forwarding proposed" within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. For each PDU session that the target NG-RAN node decides to admit the data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node includes the PDU Session level DL data forwarding GTP-U Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resource Admitted Info IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node has not yet received the SDAP end marker packet if QoS flow re-mapping happened before handover, the source NG-RAN node shall include the UL Forwarding Proposal IE within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, and if the target NG-RAN node decides to admit uplink data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources Admitted Item IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the uplink data forwarding.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DL Forwarding IE set to "DL forwarding proposed" within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. For each PDU session that the target NG-RAN node decides to admit the data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node includes the PDU Session level DL data forwarding GTP-U Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resource Admitted Info IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message.
9.2.1.17 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored. 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.

9.2.3.95 UL Forwarding Proposal - Section Description: This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node has not yet received the SDAP end marker packet if QoS flow re-mapping happened before handover, the source NG-RAN node shall include the UL Forwarding Proposal IE within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, and if the target NG-RAN node decides to admit uplink data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources Admitted Item IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the uplink data forwarding.
│  │     │  └─Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List

9.2.1.17 Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE Semantics: Usage of the DRB IDs indicated in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE is specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.15 DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs containing information about the mapped QoS flows. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each DRB for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DRB ID IE and the mapped QoS Flows List IE within the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE contained in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. The source NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB. If the target NG-RAN node decides to use the same DRB configuration and to map the same QoS flows as the source NG-RAN node, the target NG-RAN node includes the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Response DRB List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this DRB.

9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each DRB for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DRB ID IE and the mapped QoS Flows List IE within the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE contained in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. The source NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB. If the target NG-RAN node decides to use the same DRB configuration and to map the same QoS flows as the source NG-RAN node, the target NG-RAN node includes the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Response DRB List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this DRB.

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each DRB for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DRB ID IE and the mapped QoS Flows List IE within the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE contained in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. The source NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB. If the target NG-RAN node decides to use the same DRB configuration and to map the same QoS flows as the source NG-RAN node, the target NG-RAN node includes the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Response DRB List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this DRB.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each DRB for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DRB ID IE and the mapped QoS Flows List IE within the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE contained in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. The source NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB. If the target NG-RAN node decides to use the same DRB configuration and to map the same QoS flows as the source NG-RAN node, the target NG-RAN node includes the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Response DRB List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this DRB.

9.2.1.15 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB.

9.2.3.92 Common Network Instance - Section Description: This IE provides the common network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7] in a format common with 5GC.

9.1.1.1 RRC Context IE Semantics: Either includes the HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 10.2.2. of TS 36.331 [14], if the target NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, or the HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10], if the target NG-RAN node is a gNB.

9.1.1.1 Location Reporting Information IE Semantics: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting. 9.2.3.47 Location Reporting Information - Section Description: This information element indicates how the location information should be reported. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Location Reporting Information IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, then the target NG-RAN node should initiate the requested location reporting functionality as defined in TS 38.413 [5].
ENUMERATED ( report upon change of serving cell, report UE moving presence into or out of the Area of Interest, …)
9.2.3.48 Area of Interest Information - Section Description: This IE contains indicates the Area of Interest information, which may contain multiple Areas of Interest, as specified in TS 23.502 [13].
│  │     ├─List of TAIs in Area of Interest

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

9.2.3.48 List of Cells in Area of Interest IE Semantics: This IE may need to be refined with SA2.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.9 NG-RAN Cell Identity - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.
9.2.2.9 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.9 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.8).

9.2.2.1 Global gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify a gNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.1 gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.
9.2.2.2 Global ng-eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.2 Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Short Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Long Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

9.2.3.58 Request Reporting Reference ID - Section Description: This IE contains the Request Reporting Reference ID and is used for UE presence in Area of Interest reporting as specified in TS 23.502 [13].

9.2.3.53 Mobility Restriction List - Section Description: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility actions for which the NR-RAN provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation or for assigning proper RNAs. If the NG-RAN receives the Mobility Restriction List IE, it shall overwrite previously received restriction information. NG-RAN behaviour upon receiving this IE is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Mobility Restriction List IE is - contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target NG-RAN node shall - store the information received in the Mobility Restriction List IE in the UE context; - use this information to determine a target for the UE during subsequent mobility action for which the NG-RAN node provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, except when one of the PDU sessions has a particular ARP value (TS 23.501 [7]) in which case the information shall not apply; - use this information to select a proper SCG during dual connectivity operation. - use this information to select proper RNA(s) for the UE when moving the UE to RRC_INACTIVE. - not contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target NG-RAN node shall - consider that no roaming and no access restriction apply to the UE.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.53 Equivalent PLMNs IE Semantics: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of “equivalent PLMNs” as defined in TS 24.501 [30]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the Serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 RAT Restrictions IE Semantics: This IE contains RAT restriction related information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.53 RAT Restriction Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. This version of the specification does not use bits 3-7, the sending node shall set bits 3-7 to "0", the sender shall ignore bits 3-7.

9.2.3.53 Extended RAT Restriction Information IE Semantics: If this IE is included, the RAT Restriction Information IE is ignored. 9.2.3.99 Extended RAT Restriction Information - Section Description: This element provides RAT restrictions as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.99 Primary RAT Restriction IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 3-7 reserved for future use. The Primary RAT is the RAT used in the access cell, or target cell.
BIT STRING { e-UTRA (0), nR (1), e-UTRA-unlicensed (2), nR-unlicensed (3)} (SIZE (8, …))

9.2.3.99 Secondary RAT Restriction IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 4-7 reserved for future use. A Secondary RAT is a RAT used in any cell serving the UE excluding the PCell.
9.2.3.53 Forbidden Area Information IE Semantics: This IE contains Forbidden Area information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the forbidden TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.3.53 Service Area Information IE Semantics: This IE contains Service Area Restriction information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the allowed TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the not-allowed TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.100 5GC Mobility Restriction List Container - Section Description: This IE contains the Mobility Restriction List IE specified in TS 38.413 [5] as received by the NG-RAN from the 5GC. 9.2.3.100 5GC Mobility Restriction List Container IE Semantics: The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the Mobility Restriction List IE specified in TS 38.413 [5]. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the 5GC Mobility Restriction List Container IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store this information in the UE context and use it as specified in TS 38.300 [9].

9.2.3.55 Trace Activation - Section Description: This IE defines parameters related to a trace activation. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Trace Activation IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target NG-RAN node shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as specified in TS 32.422 [23].

9.2.3.97 NG-RAN Trace ID - Section Description: This IE defines the NG-RAN Trace ID. 9.2.3.97 NG-RAN Trace ID IE Semantics: This IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information encoded as in 9.2.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (last 2 octets).

9.2.3.55 Interfaces To Trace IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an NG-RAN node interface: first bit = NG-C, second bit = Xn-C, third bit = Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1: other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.
ENUMERATED (minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, …)
9.2.3.55 Trace Depth IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.422 [23].
9.2.3.55 Trace Collection Entity IP Address IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.422 [23] 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.

9.2.3.32 Masked IMEISV - Section Description: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment. 9.2.3.32 Masked IMEISV IE Semantics: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [22] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Masked IMEISV IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use it to determine the characteristics of the UE for subsequent handling.

9.2.3.64 UE History Information - Section Description: The UE History Information IE contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in active state prior to the target cell. The overall mechanism is described in TS 36.300 [12]. NOTE: The definition of this IE is aligned with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 38.413 [5]. 9.2.3.64 Last Visited Cell List IE Semantics: Most recent information is added to the top of this list 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of UE History Information IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target NG-RAN node shall collect the information defined as mandatory in the UE History Information IE and shall, if supported, collect the information defined as optional in the UE History Information IE, for as long as the UE stays in one of its cells, and store the collected information to be used for future handover preparations.
9.2.3.65 Last Visited Cell Information - Section Description: The Last Visited Cell Information may contain cell specific information.

9.2.3.65 Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].
9.2.3.65 Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 25.413 [32].
9.2.3.65 Last Visited GERAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.1 gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.
9.2.2.2 Global ng-eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.2 Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Short Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Long Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

section_list.name: HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message is sent by the target NG-RAN node to inform the source NG-RAN node about the prepared resources at the target.
Direction: target NG-RAN node ? source NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.1.2 Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.1.2 Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.2.1.2 PDU Session Resources Admitted List - Section Description: This IE contains PDU session resource related information to report success of the establishment of PDU session resources. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DL Forwarding IE set to "DL forwarding proposed" within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. For each PDU session that the target NG-RAN node decides to admit the data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node includes the PDU Session level DL data forwarding GTP-U Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resource Admitted Info IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node has not yet received the SDAP end marker packet if QoS flow re-mapping happened before handover, the source NG-RAN node shall include the UL Forwarding Proposal IE within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, and if the target NG-RAN node decides to admit uplink data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources Admitted Item IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the uplink data forwarding. If the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE for a given DRB in the Data Forwarding Response DRB List IE within Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE and the source NG-RAN node accepts the data forwarding proposed by the target NG-RAN node, the source NG-RAN node shall perform forwarding of uplink data for the DRB.

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node has not yet received the SDAP end marker packet if QoS flow re-mapping happened before handover, the source NG-RAN node shall include the UL Forwarding Proposal IE within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, and if the target NG-RAN node decides to admit uplink data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources Admitted Item IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the uplink data forwarding.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each QoS flow for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DL Forwarding IE set to "DL forwarding proposed" within the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. For each PDU session that the target NG-RAN node decides to admit the data forwarding for at least one QoS flow, the target NG-RAN node includes the PDU Session level DL data forwarding GTP-U Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resource Admitted Info IE contained in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message.
9.2.1.2 DL NG-U TNL Information Unchanged IE Semantics: Indicates the NG-U tunnels that have been kept unchanged at the target NG-RAN node
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.1.4 QoS Flow List with Cause - Section Description: This IE contains a list of QoS flows with a cause value.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each DRB for which the source NG-RAN node proposes to perform forwarding of downlink data, the source NG-RAN node shall include the DRB ID IE and the mapped QoS Flows List IE within the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE contained in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message. The source NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB. If the target NG-RAN node decides to use the same DRB configuration and to map the same QoS flows as the source NG-RAN node, the target NG-RAN node includes the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the Data Forwarding Response DRB List IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this DRB. If the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE for a given DRB in the Data Forwarding Response DRB List IE within Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE in the PDU Session Resources Admitted List IE and the source NG-RAN node accepts the data forwarding proposed by the target NG-RAN node, the source NG-RAN node shall perform forwarding of uplink data for the DRB.

9.2.1.3 PDU Session Resources Not Admitted List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of PDU session resources which were not admitted to be added or modified. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the HANDOVER REQUEST includes PDU session resources for PDU sessions associated to S-NSSAIs not supported by target NG-RAN, the target NG-RAN shall reject such PDU session resources. In this case, and if at least one PDU Session Resource To Be Setup Item IE is admitted, the target NG-RAN shall send the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message including the PDU Session Resources Not Admitted List IE listing corresponding PDU sessions rejected at the target NG-RAN.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
