9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
│     └─Secondary MN DL Xn UP TNL Information

9.2.1.30 Secondary MN DL Xn UP TNL Information IE Semantics: M-NG-RAN node endpoint of a DRB’s Xn-U transport. For delivery of DL PDUs in case of PDCP Duplication. 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.1.1.11 DRB IDs taken into use IE Semantics: Indicating the DRB IDs taken into use by the target NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.2.6 XN-U Address Indication 8.2.6.2 Successful Operation If the XN-U ADDRESS INDICATION message includes the DRB IDs taken into use IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if applicable, act as specified in TS 37.340 [8].
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

section_list.name: S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN node to the S-NG-RAN node to request the preparation of resources for dual connectivity operation for a specific UE.
Direction: M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.1 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
9.2.3.49 UE Security Capabilities - Section Description: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE.

9.2.3.49 NR Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, “first bit” – 128-NEA1, “second bit” – 128-NEA2, “third bit” – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

9.2.3.49 NR Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, “first bit” – 128-NIA1, “second bit” – 128-NIA2, “third bit” – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

9.2.3.49 E-UTRA Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0, “first bit” – 128-EEA1, “second bit” – 128-EEA2, “third bit” – 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

9.2.3.49 E-UTRA Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0, “first bit” – 128-EIA1, “second bit” – 128-EIA2, “third bit” – 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

9.2.3.51 S-NG-RAN node Security Key - Section Description: The S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE is used to apply security in the S-NG-RAN node as defined in TS 33.501 [28]. 9.2.3.51 S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE Semantics: The S-KSN which is provided by the M-NG-RAN node, see TS 33.501 [28].
├─S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate

9.1.2.1 S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into M-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node respectively. 9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and a subscription parameter provided by the AMF to the NG-RAN. 9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.1.2.1 Selected PLMN IE Semantics: The selected PLMN of the SCG in the S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC). 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Selected PLMN IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it for RRM purposes.

9.2.3.53 Mobility Restriction List - Section Description: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility actions for which the NR-RAN provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation or for assigning proper RNAs. If the NG-RAN receives the Mobility Restriction List IE, it shall overwrite previously received restriction information. NG-RAN behaviour upon receiving this IE is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Mobility Restriction List IE, the S-NG-RAN node, if supported, shall store this information and use it to select an appropriate SCG.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.53 Equivalent PLMNs IE Semantics: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of “equivalent PLMNs” as defined in TS 24.501 [30]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the Serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 RAT Restrictions IE Semantics: This IE contains RAT restriction related information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.53 RAT Restriction Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. This version of the specification does not use bits 3-7, the sending node shall set bits 3-7 to "0", the sender shall ignore bits 3-7.

9.2.3.53 Extended RAT Restriction Information IE Semantics: If this IE is included, the RAT Restriction Information IE is ignored. 9.2.3.99 Extended RAT Restriction Information - Section Description: This element provides RAT restrictions as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.99 Primary RAT Restriction IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 3-7 reserved for future use. The Primary RAT is the RAT used in the access cell, or target cell.
BIT STRING { e-UTRA (0), nR (1), e-UTRA-unlicensed (2), nR-unlicensed (3)} (SIZE (8, …))

9.2.3.99 Secondary RAT Restriction IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 4-7 reserved for future use. A Secondary RAT is a RAT used in any cell serving the UE excluding the PCell.
9.2.3.53 Forbidden Area Information IE Semantics: This IE contains Forbidden Area information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the forbidden TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.3.53 Service Area Information IE Semantics: This IE contains Service Area Restriction information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the allowed TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the not-allowed TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

9.2.3.53 Last E-UTRAN PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Indicates the E-UTRAN PLMN ID from where the UE formerly handed over to 5GS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to EPS. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
│  ├─Core Network Type Restriction for serving PLMN
9.2.3.53 Core Network Type Restriction for serving PLMN IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to EPC for the Serving PLMN as specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│  └─Core Network Type Restriction for Equivalent PLMNs

9.2.3.53 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Includes any of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which CN Type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 Core Network Type Restriction IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to EPC or to 5GC for this PLMN.

9.2.3.23 Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority - Section Description: The Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE is used to define local configuration for RRM strategies such as camp priorities and control of inter-RAT/inter-frequency mobility in RRC_CONNECTED, as specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it for RRM purposes.
├─PDU Session Resources To Be Added List
│  └─PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item

9.1.2.1 PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE Semantics: NOTE: If neither the PDU Session Resource Setup Info – SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Setup Info – MN terminated IE is present in a PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE, abnormal conditions as specified in clause 8.3.1.4 apply.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.21 S-NSSAI - Section Description: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].
│     ├─S-NG-RAN node PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate

9.2.3.69 PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per PDU session which is defined for the downlink and the uplink direction and is provided at the Handover Preparation procedure to the target NG-RAN node and at the Retrieve UE Context procedure to the new NG-RAN node as received by the 5GC, during dual connectivity related procedures to the to the S-NG-RAN node as decided by the M-NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message contains the S-NG-RAN node PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it for RRM purposes.
│     │  ├─PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│     │  └─PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│     ├─PDU Session Resource Setup Info – SN terminated

9.2.1.5 PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains information for the addition of S-NG-RAN node resources related to a PDU session for DRBs configured with an SN terminated bearer option.
│     │  ├─UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF

9.2.1.5 UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF IE Semantics: UPF endpoint of the NG-U transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
9.2.3.19 PDU Session Type - Section Description: This IE defines the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.1.5 Network Instance IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored if the Common Network Instance IE is present. 9.2.3.85 Network Instance - Section Description: This IE provides the network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.1.5 QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: For GBR QoS flows, this IE contains GBR QoS flow information as received at NG-C 9.2.3.5 QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be applied to a QoS flow.
9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.
9.2.3.8 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.5 GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
9.2.3.6 Notification Control IE Semantics: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.
9.2.3.5 Reflective QoS Attribute IE Semantics: Reflective QoS is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE applies to Non-GBR bearers only and is ignored otherwise.

9.2.3.5 Additional QoS flow Information IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "more likely", this indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the Additional QoS flow Information IE is included for a QoS flow in the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave the same as the NG-RAN node in the PDU Session Resource Setup procedure, specified in TS 38.413 [5].
9.2.3.5 QoS Monitoring Request IE Semantics: Indicates to measure UL, or DL, or both UL/DL delays for the associated QoS flow.

9.2.1.5 Offered GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE contains M-Node offered GBR QoS Flow Information. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
9.2.3.6 Notification Control IE Semantics: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.
│     │  ├─Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node

9.2.1.17 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains information from a source NG-RAN node regarding per QoS flow proposed data forwarding and offloading. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node may also propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation For each bearer for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the S-NG-RAN node: - the M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message. For each bearer that it has decided to admit, the S-NG-RAN node may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. - the S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicates it request data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the M-NG-RAN node shall include RLC Mode IE for each bearer offloaded from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node in the DRBs to QoS Flow Mapping List IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDTION REQUEST message, and the RLC Mode IE indicates the mode that the M-NG-RAN used for the DRB when it was hosted at the M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.1.17 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored. 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.

9.2.3.95 UL Forwarding Proposal - Section Description: This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node may also propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
│     │  │  └─Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List

9.2.1.17 Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE Semantics: Usage of the DRB IDs indicated in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE is specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.15 DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs containing information about the mapped QoS flows.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message contains the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE, the S-NG-RAN node may take it into account that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB.

9.2.1.15 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation For each bearer for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the S-NG-RAN node: - the M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message. For each bearer that it has decided to admit, the S-NG-RAN node may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. - the S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicates it request data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the M-NG-RAN node shall include RLC Mode IE for each bearer offloaded from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node in the DRBs to QoS Flow Mapping List IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDTION REQUEST message, and the RLC Mode IE indicates the mode that the M-NG-RAN used for the DRB when it was hosted at the M-NG-RAN node.

9.2.3.52 Security Indication - Section Description: This IE contains the user plane integrity protection indication and confidentiality protection indication which indicates the requirements on UP integrity protection and ciphering for the corresponding PDU session, respectively. Additionally, this IE contains the maximum integrity protected data rate values (UL and DL) per UE for integrity protected DRBs. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the Security Indication IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message, the behaviour of the S-NG-RAN node shall be the same as specified for the same IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the Handover Preparation procedure, for the concerned PDU session, and the S-NG-RAN node shall include the Security Result IE in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE.

9.2.3.52 Integrity Protection Indication IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the Security Result IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node may take the information into account when deciding whether to perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering for the DRBs that it establishes for the concerned PDU session, except if the Split Session Indicator IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE and set to "split", in which case it shall perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering according to the information in the Security Result IE. If the S-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, it shall reject all PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "required" as specified in TS 33.501 [28]. If either the S-NG-RAN node or the M-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave according to clause 6.10.4 of TS 33.501 [28] for PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred". 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message containing, for a PDU session, a PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE for which the Split Session Indicator IE is included and set to "split", the Security Result IE is not included, and either the Integrity Protection Indication IE or the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred", it shall reject the PDU session.

9.2.3.52 Confidentiality Protection Indication IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message containing, for a PDU session, a PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE for which the Split Session Indicator IE is included and set to "split", the Security Result IE is not included, and either the Integrity Protection Indication IE or the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred", it shall reject the PDU session.

9.2.3.52 - Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE - ifIntegrityProtectionrequiredorpreferred: This IE shall be present if the Integrity Protection IE within the Security Indication IE is present and set to “required” or “preferred”. 9.2.3.52 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: If present, this IE contains the values received from the CN for the overall UE capability. This IE may be ignored by the SN in the case of dual connectivity. 9.2.3.73 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in UL. If the Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE is absent, this IE applies to both UL and DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in the DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

9.2.1.5 Security Result IE Semantics: Indicates security activation status in MN. 9.2.3.67 Security Result - Section Description: This IE indicates whether the security policy indicated as "preferred" in the Security Indication IE is performed or not. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the Security Indication IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message, the behaviour of the S-NG-RAN node shall be the same as specified for the same IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the Handover Preparation procedure, for the concerned PDU session, and the S-NG-RAN node shall include the Security Result IE in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE. If the Security Result IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node may take the information into account when deciding whether to perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering for the DRBs that it establishes for the concerned PDU session, except if the Split Session Indicator IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE and set to "split", in which case it shall perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering according to the information in the Security Result IE. If the S-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, it shall reject all PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "required" as specified in TS 33.501 [28]. If either the S-NG-RAN node or the M-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave according to clause 6.10.4 of TS 33.501 [28] for PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred". 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message containing, for a PDU session, a PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE for which the Split Session Indicator IE is included and set to "split", the Security Result IE is not included, and either the Integrity Protection Indication IE or the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred", it shall reject the PDU session.
9.2.3.67 Integrity Protection Result IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP integrity protection is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.
9.2.3.67 Confidentiality Protection Result IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP ciphering is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

9.2.3.92 Common Network Instance - Section Description: This IE provides the common network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7] in a format common with 5GC.

9.2.3.93 Default DRB Allowed - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether the SN is allowed to configure the default DRB for a PDU session or not. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the Default DRB Allowed IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message and set to "true", the S-NG-RAN node may configure the default DRB for the PDU session.

9.2.3.94 Split Session Indicator - Section Description: This IE indicates whether admitting the requested resources results in a split PDU session. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the Security Result IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node may take the information into account when deciding whether to perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering for the DRBs that it establishes for the concerned PDU session, except if the Split Session Indicator IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE and set to "split", in which case it shall perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering according to the information in the Security Result IE. If the S-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, it shall reject all PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "required" as specified in TS 33.501 [28]. If either the S-NG-RAN node or the M-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave according to clause 6.10.4 of TS 33.501 [28] for PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred". 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message containing, for a PDU session, a PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE for which the Split Session Indicator IE is included and set to "split", the Security Result IE is not included, and either the Integrity Protection Indication IE or the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred", it shall reject the PDU session.
9.2.3.98 Non-GBR Resources Offered - Section Description: This IE indicates whether the MCG offers non-GBR resources for non-GBR QoS flows of the PDU Session Resource.
│     └─PDU Session Resource Setup Info – MN terminated

9.2.1.7 PDU Session Resource Setup Info - MN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains information for the addition of S-NG-RAN node resources related to a PDU session for DRBs configured with an MN terminated bearer option.
9.2.3.19 PDU Session Type - Section Description: This IE defines the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.1.7 MN UL PDCP UP TNL Information IE Semantics: M-NG-RAN node endpoint(s) of a DRB’s Xn-U transport bearer at its PDCP resource. For delivery of UL PDUs. 9.2.3.76 UP Transport Parameters - Section Description: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

9.2.1.7 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode to be used in the assisting node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation For each bearer for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the S-NG-RAN node: - the M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message. For each bearer that it has decided to admit, the S-NG-RAN node may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. - the S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicates it request data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the M-NG-RAN node shall include RLC Mode IE for each bearer offloaded from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node in the DRBs to QoS Flow Mapping List IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE ADDTION REQUEST message, and the RLC Mode IE indicates the mode that the M-NG-RAN used for the DRB when it was hosted at the M-NG-RAN node.

9.2.1.7 UL Configuration IE Semantics: Information about UL usage in the S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.75 UL Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the corresponding node. 9.2.3.75 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the corresponding node.
9.2.3.5 QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be applied to a QoS flow.
9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.
9.2.3.8 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.5 GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the Additional QoS flow Information IE is included for a QoS flow in the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave the same as the NG-RAN node in the PDU Session Resource Setup procedure, specified in TS 38.413 [5].
9.2.3.5 QoS Monitoring Request IE Semantics: Indicates to measure UL, or DL, or both UL/DL delays for the associated QoS flow.

9.2.1.7 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP SN length of the DRB. 9.2.3.63 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message contains the PDCP SN Length IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store this information and use it for lower layer configuration of the concerned MN terminated bearer.
9.2.3.63 UL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for UL.
9.2.3.63 DL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for DL.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE is contained in the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store this information and use it as defined in TS 37.340 [8].

9.2.3.81 Expected UE Behaviour - Section Description: This IE indicates the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the NG-RAN node in determining the optimum RRC connection time and to help with the RRC_INACTIVE state transition and RNA configuration (e.g. size and shape of the RNA). 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Expected UE Behaviour IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store this information and may use it to optimize resource allocation.
9.2.3.82 Expected UE Activity Behaviour - Section Description: This IE indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.82 Expected Activity Period IE Semantics: If set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].
9.2.3.82 Expected Idle Period IE Semantics: If set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

9.2.3.82 Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information IE Semantics: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.

9.2.3.81 Expected HO Interval IE Semantics: Indicates the expected time interval between inter NG-RAN node handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter NG-RAN node handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.
9.2.3.81 Expected UE Mobility IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is expected to be stationary or mobile.
9.2.3.81 Expected UE Moving Trajectory IE Semantics: Indicates the UE's expected geographical movement.

9.2.3.81 Expected UE Moving Trajectory Item IE Semantics: Includes list of visited and non-visited cells, where visited cells are listed in the order the UE visited them with the most recent cell being the first in the list. Non-visited cells are included immediately after the visited cell they are associated with.
9.2.2.27 Global NG-RAN Cell Identity - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.9 NG-RAN Cell Identity - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.
9.2.2.9 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.9 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.8).

9.2.3.81 Time Stayed in Cell IE Semantics: Included for visited cells and indicates the time a UE stayed in a cell in seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095 seconds, this IE is set to 4095.
9.1.2.1 Requested Split SRBs IE Semantics: Indicates that resources for Split SRBs are requested.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.9 NG-RAN Cell Identity - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.
9.2.2.9 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.9 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.8).

9.2.3.77 Desired Activity Notification Level - Section Description: This IE contains information on which level activity notification shall be performed. 8.3.1 S-NG-RAN node Addition Preparation 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation Upon receiving an S-NODE ADDITION REQUEST message containing the Desired Activity Notification Level IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use this information to decide whether to trigger subsequent Activation Notification procedures according to the requested notification level.

9.1.2.1 - Available DRB IDs IE - ifSNterminated: This IE shall be present if there is at least one PDU Session Resource Setup Info – SN terminated in the PDU Session Resources To Be Added List IE. 9.1.2.1 Available DRB IDs IE Semantics: Indicates the list of DRB IDs that the S-NG-RAN node may use for SN-terminated bearers. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs.
