9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and a subscription parameter provided by the AMF to the NG-RAN. 9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall: - replace the previously provided S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate by the received S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in the UE context; - use the received S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate for Non-GBR Bearers for the concerned UE as defined in TS 37.340 [8].

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.23 Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority - Section Description: The Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE is used to define local configuration for RRM strategies such as camp priorities and control of inter-RAT/inter-frequency mobility in RRC_CONNECTED, as specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it for RRM purposes.
ENUMERATED (release lower layers, re-establish lower layers, ..., suspend lower layers, resume lower layers)

9.2.3.60 Lower Layer presence status change - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate that lower layer resources' presence status shall be changed. If the presence status is set to "release lower layers" or "suspend lower layers", SDAP entities, PDCP entities, Xn-U bearer resources, NG-U bearer resources and UE context information shall be kept. 9.2.3.60 Lower Layer presence status change IE Semantics: "re-establish lower layers" is only set after "release lower layers" has been indicated. "resume lower layers" shall restore SCG. "resume lower layers" shall be only set after "suspend lower layers" has been indicated. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Lower Layer presence status change IE set to "release lower layers" is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall act as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. If the Lower Layer presence status change IE set to "re-establish lower layers" is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall act as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. If the Lower Layer presence status change IE set to "suspend lower layers" is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall act as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. If the Lower Layer presence status change IE set to "resume lower layers" is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall act as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the Lower Layer presence status change IE set to "re-establish lower layers" is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message and was not set to "release lower layers" before, the S-NG-RAN node shall ignore the IE.

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  │     ├─PDU Session Resource Setup Info – SN terminated

9.2.1.5 PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains information for the addition of S-NG-RAN node resources related to a PDU session for DRBs configured with an SN terminated bearer option.
│  │     │  ├─UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF

9.2.1.5 UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF IE Semantics: UPF endpoint of the NG-U transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains for a PDU session resource to be modified which is configured with the SN terminated bearer option, the UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF IE the S-NG-RAN node shall use it as the new UL NG-U address.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
9.2.3.19 PDU Session Type - Section Description: This IE defines the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.1.5 Network Instance IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored if the Common Network Instance IE is present. 9.2.3.85 Network Instance - Section Description: This IE provides the network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.1.5 QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: For GBR QoS flows, this IE contains GBR QoS flow information as received at NG-C 9.2.3.5 QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be applied to a QoS flow.
9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.
9.2.3.8 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.5 GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
9.2.3.6 Notification Control IE Semantics: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.
9.2.3.5 Reflective QoS Attribute IE Semantics: Reflective QoS is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE applies to Non-GBR bearers only and is ignored otherwise.

9.2.3.5 Additional QoS flow Information IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "more likely", this indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Additional QoS flow Information IE is included for a QoS flow in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave the same as the NG-RAN node in the PDU Session Resource Setup procedure, specified in TS 38.413 [5].
9.2.3.5 QoS Monitoring Request IE Semantics: Indicates to measure UL, or DL, or both UL/DL delays for the associated QoS flow.

9.2.1.5 Offered GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE contains M-Node offered GBR QoS Flow Information. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.17 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains information from a source NG-RAN node regarding per QoS flow proposed data forwarding and offloading. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data for the QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation For each bearer for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the S-NG-RAN node: - if applicable, the M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each bearer that it has decided to admit, the S-NG-RAN node may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. - the S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer.
9.2.1.17 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored. 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.

9.2.3.95 UL Forwarding Proposal - Section Description: This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data for the QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.

9.2.1.17 Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE Semantics: Usage of the DRB IDs indicated in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE is specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.15 DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs containing information about the mapped QoS flows.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message for a QoS flow to be modified, the S-NG-RAN node may replace and take it into account that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB.

9.2.1.15 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node shall include RLC Mode IE for each bearer offloaded from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node in the DRBs to QoS Flow Mapping List IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, and the RLC Mode IE indicates the mode that the M-NG-RAN used for the DRB when it was hosted at the M-NG-RAN node. If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.

9.2.3.52 Security Indication - Section Description: This IE contains the user plane integrity protection indication and confidentiality protection indication which indicates the requirements on UP integrity protection and ciphering for the corresponding PDU session, respectively. Additionally, this IE contains the maximum integrity protected data rate values (UL and DL) per UE for integrity protected DRBs. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Security Indication IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the behaviour of the S-NG-RAN node shall be the same as specified for the same IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the Handover Preparation procedure, for the concerned PDU session, and the S-NG-RAN node shall include the Security Result IE in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE.

9.2.3.52 Integrity Protection Indication IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Security Result IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node may take the information into account when deciding whether to perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering for the DRBs that it establishes for the concerned PDU session, except if the Split Session Indicator IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE and set to "split", in which case it shall perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering according to the information in the Security Result IE. If the S-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, it shall reject all PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "required" as specified in TS 33.501 [28]. If either the S-NG-RAN node or the M-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave according to clause 6.10.4 of TS 33.501 [28] for PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred". 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing, for a PDU session, a PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE for which the Split Session Indicator IE is included and set to "split", the Security Result IE is not included, and either the Integrity Protection Indication IE or the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred", it shall reject the PDU session.

9.2.3.52 Confidentiality Protection Indication IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing, for a PDU session, a PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE for which the Split Session Indicator IE is included and set to "split", the Security Result IE is not included, and either the Integrity Protection Indication IE or the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred", it shall reject the PDU session.

9.2.3.52 - Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE - ifIntegrityProtectionrequiredorpreferred: This IE shall be present if the Integrity Protection IE within the Security Indication IE is present and set to “required” or “preferred”. 9.2.3.52 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: If present, this IE contains the values received from the CN for the overall UE capability. This IE may be ignored by the SN in the case of dual connectivity. 9.2.3.73 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in UL. If the Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE is absent, this IE applies to both UL and DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in the DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

9.2.1.5 Security Result IE Semantics: Indicates security activation status in MN. 9.2.3.67 Security Result - Section Description: This IE indicates whether the security policy indicated as "preferred" in the Security Indication IE is performed or not. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Security Indication IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the behaviour of the S-NG-RAN node shall be the same as specified for the same IE in the PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List IE in the Handover Preparation procedure, for the concerned PDU session, and the S-NG-RAN node shall include the Security Result IE in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE. If the Security Result IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node may take the information into account when deciding whether to perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering for the DRBs that it establishes for the concerned PDU session, except if the Split Session Indicator IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE and set to "split", in which case it shall perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering according to the information in the Security Result IE. If the S-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, it shall reject all PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "required" as specified in TS 33.501 [28]. If either the S-NG-RAN node or the M-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave according to clause 6.10.4 of TS 33.501 [28] for PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred". 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing, for a PDU session, a PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE for which the Split Session Indicator IE is included and set to "split", the Security Result IE is not included, and either the Integrity Protection Indication IE or the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred", it shall reject the PDU session.
9.2.3.67 Integrity Protection Result IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP integrity protection is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.
9.2.3.67 Confidentiality Protection Result IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP ciphering is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

9.2.3.92 Common Network Instance - Section Description: This IE provides the common network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7] in a format common with 5GC.

9.2.3.93 Default DRB Allowed - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether the SN is allowed to configure the default DRB for a PDU session or not. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Default DRB Allowed IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message and set to "true", the S-NG-RAN node may configure the default DRB for the PDU session. If the Default DRB Allowed IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message and set to "false", the S-NG-RAN node shall not configure the default DRB for the PDU session and the S-NG-RAN shall reconfigure the default DRB into a normal DRB if it has configured the default DRB before.

9.2.3.94 Split Session Indicator - Section Description: This IE indicates whether admitting the requested resources results in a split PDU session. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Security Result IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node may take the information into account when deciding whether to perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering for the DRBs that it establishes for the concerned PDU session, except if the Split Session Indicator IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE and set to "split", in which case it shall perform user plane integrity protection or ciphering according to the information in the Security Result IE. If the S-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, it shall reject all PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "required" as specified in TS 33.501 [28]. If either the S-NG-RAN node or the M-NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave according to clause 6.10.4 of TS 33.501 [28] for PDU sessions for which the Integrity Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred". 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing, for a PDU session, a PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE for which the Split Session Indicator IE is included and set to "split", the Security Result IE is not included, and either the Integrity Protection Indication IE or the Confidentiality Protection Indication IE is set to "preferred", it shall reject the PDU session.
9.2.3.98 Non-GBR Resources Offered - Section Description: This IE indicates whether the MCG offers non-GBR resources for non-GBR QoS flows of the PDU Session Resource.
│  │     └─PDU Session Resource Setup Info – MN terminated

9.2.1.7 PDU Session Resource Setup Info - MN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains information for the addition of S-NG-RAN node resources related to a PDU session for DRBs configured with an MN terminated bearer option.
9.2.3.19 PDU Session Type - Section Description: This IE defines the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the PDCP SN Length IE in the DRBs To Be Setup List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store this information and use it for lower layer configuration of the concerned MN terminated bearer.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.1.7 MN UL PDCP UP TNL Information IE Semantics: M-NG-RAN node endpoint(s) of a DRB’s Xn-U transport bearer at its PDCP resource. For delivery of UL PDUs. 9.2.3.76 UP Transport Parameters - Section Description: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains for a PDU session resource to be modified which is configured with the MN terminated bearer option, the MN UL PDCP UP TNL Information IE the S-NG-RAN node shall use it as the new UL Xn-U address.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

9.2.1.7 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode to be used in the assisting node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node shall include RLC Mode IE for each bearer offloaded from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node in the DRBs to QoS Flow Mapping List IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, and the RLC Mode IE indicates the mode that the M-NG-RAN used for the DRB when it was hosted at the M-NG-RAN node. If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.

9.2.1.7 UL Configuration IE Semantics: Information about UL usage in the S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.75 UL Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the corresponding node. 9.2.3.75 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the corresponding node.

9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Additional QoS flow Information IE is included for a QoS flow in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall behave the same as the NG-RAN node in the PDU Session Resource Setup procedure, specified in TS 38.413 [5].
9.2.3.5 QoS Monitoring Request IE Semantics: Indicates to measure UL, or DL, or both UL/DL delays for the associated QoS flow.

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message for a QoS flow to be modified, the S-NG-RAN node may replace and take it into account that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB.

8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NSSAI IE is included in the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified List IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall replace the previously S-NSSAI IE by the received S-NSSAI IE.

9.1.2.5 PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE Semantics: NOTE: If neither the PDU Session Resource Modification Info – SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Modification Info – MN terminated IE is present in a PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE, abnormal conditions as specified in clause 8.3.3.4 apply. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message including a PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE, containing neither the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - MN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall fail the S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation procedure indicating an appropriate cause.

9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple PDU Session ID IEs (in the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE) set to the same value, the S-NG-RAN node shall initiate the release of one corresponding PDU Session and ignore the duplication of the instances of the selected corresponding PDU Sessions.

9.2.3.69 PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per PDU session which is defined for the downlink and the uplink direction and is provided at the Handover Preparation procedure to the target NG-RAN node and at the Retrieve UE Context procedure to the new NG-RAN node as received by the 5GC, during dual connectivity related procedures to the to the S-NG-RAN node as decided by the M-NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the S-NG-RAN node PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it for RRM purposes.
│  │     │  ├─PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  │     │  └─PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.9 UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF IE Semantics: UPF endpoint of the NG-U transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains for a PDU session resource to be modified which is configured with the SN terminated bearer option, the UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF IE the S-NG-RAN node shall use it as the new UL NG-U address.

9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.1.9 Network Instance IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored if the Common Network Instance IE is present. 9.2.3.85 Network Instance - Section Description: This IE provides the network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.
9.2.3.8 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.9 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE Semantics: Applicable for the QoS flows contained in the QoS Flows To Be Setup List IE. 9.2.1.17 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains information from a source NG-RAN node regarding per QoS flow proposed data forwarding and offloading. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data for the QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation For each bearer for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the S-NG-RAN node: - if applicable, the M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each bearer that it has decided to admit, the S-NG-RAN node may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. - the S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer.
9.2.1.17 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored. 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.

9.2.3.95 UL Forwarding Proposal - Section Description: This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data for the QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.

9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message for a QoS flow to be modified, the S-NG-RAN node may replace and take it into account that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB.

9.2.1.15 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node shall include RLC Mode IE for each bearer offloaded from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node in the DRBs to QoS Flow Mapping List IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, and the RLC Mode IE indicates the mode that the M-NG-RAN used for the DRB when it was hosted at the M-NG-RAN node. If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.5 GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.1.28 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node shall include RLC Mode IE for each bearer offloaded from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node in the DRBs to QoS Flow Mapping List IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, and the RLC Mode IE indicates the mode that the M-NG-RAN used for the DRB when it was hosted at the M-NG-RAN node. If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.

9.2.3.92 Common Network Instance - Section Description: This IE provides the common network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7] in a format common with 5GC.

9.2.3.93 Default DRB Allowed - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether the SN is allowed to configure the default DRB for a PDU session or not. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the Default DRB Allowed IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message and set to "true", the S-NG-RAN node may configure the default DRB for the PDU session. If the Default DRB Allowed IE is included in the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message and set to "false", the S-NG-RAN node shall not configure the default DRB for the PDU session and the S-NG-RAN shall reconfigure the default DRB into a normal DRB if it has configured the default DRB before.
9.2.3.98 Non-GBR Resources Offered - Section Description: This IE indicates whether the MCG offers non-GBR resources for non-GBR QoS flows of the PDU Session Resource.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

And if the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Duplication Activation IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store this information and use it for the purpose of PDCP duplication.

Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.1.11 secondary MN UL PDCP UP TNL Information IE Semantics: M-NG-RAN node endpoint(s) of a DRB’s Xn transport bearer at its PDCP resource. For delivery of UL PDUs in case of PDCP duplication. 9.2.3.76 UP Transport Parameters - Section Description: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

9.2.1.11 UL Configuration IE Semantics: Information about UL usage in the S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.75 UL Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the corresponding node. 9.2.3.75 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the corresponding node.

9.2.3.86 PDCP Duplication Configuration - Section Description: The PDCP Duplication Configuration IE indicates whether PDCP Duplication is configured or de-configured. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the PDCP Duplication Configuration IE in the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - MN terminated IE is contained in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message and set to "configured", the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, add the RLC entity of secondary path for the indicated DRB. And if the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Duplication Activation IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store this information and use it for the purpose of PDCP duplication. If the PDCP Duplication Configuration IE in the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - MN terminated IE is contained in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message and set to "de-configured", the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, delete the RLC entity of secondary path for the indicated DRB.

9.2.3.71 Duplication Activation - Section Description: The Duplication Activation IE indicates the initial status of UL PDCP duplication, i.e., whether UL PDCP Duplication is activated or not. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the PDCP Duplication Configuration IE in the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - MN terminated IE is contained in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message and set to "configured", the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, add the RLC entity of secondary path for the indicated DRB. And if the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Duplication Activation IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, store this information and use it for the purpose of PDCP duplication.

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.1.28 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node shall include RLC Mode IE for each bearer offloaded from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node in the DRBs to QoS Flow Mapping List IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, and the RLC Mode IE indicates the mode that the M-NG-RAN used for the DRB when it was hosted at the M-NG-RAN node. If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.
