9.1.2.5 M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in subclause 11.2.2. of TS 38.331 [10]. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the S-NG-RAN node receives a S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE that does not include required information as specified in TS 37.340 [8], the S-NG-RAN node shall send the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST REJECT message to the M-NG-RAN node. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If applicable, as specified in TS 37.340 [8], the S-NG-RAN node may receive, after having initiated the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification procedure, the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the measGapConfig IE as defined in TS 38.331 [10] within the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE.

9.1.2.5 Requested Split SRBs IE Semantics: Indicates that resources for Split SRBs are requested. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested Split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Requested Split SRBs IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it to add split SRBs. If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Requested Split SRBs release IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it to release split SRBs.

9.1.2.5 Requested Split SRBs release IE Semantics: Indicates that resources for Split SRBs are requested to be released. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested Split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Requested Split SRBs IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it to add split SRBs. If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Requested Split SRBs release IE, the S-NG-RAN node may use it to release split SRBs.

9.2.3.77 Desired Activity Notification Level - Section Description: This IE contains information on which level activity notification shall be performed. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation Upon receiving an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing the Desired Activity Notification Level IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use this information to decide whether to trigger subsequent Activity Notification procedures, or stop or modify ongoing triggering of these procedures due to a previous request.

9.1.2.5 Additional DRB IDs IE Semantics: Indicates additional list of DRB IDs that the S-NG-RAN node may use for SN-terminated bearers. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the Additional DRB IDs IE is included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall store this information and use it together with previously provided DRB IDs if any, for SN terminated bearers.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
├─S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Uplink

9.1.2.5 S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Uplink IE Semantics: The S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Uplink is a portion of the UE’s Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate in the Uplink, which is enforced by the S-NG-RAN node for the UE’s SN terminated PDU sessions. If the S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink IE is not present, this IE applies to both UL and DL. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Uplink IE or the S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall use the received information when enforcing the maximum integrity protected data rate for the UE.
├─S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink

9.1.2.5 S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink IE Semantics: The S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink is a portion of the UE’s Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate in the Downlink, which is enforced by the S-NG-RAN node for the UE’s SN terminated PDU sessions. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Uplink IE or the S-NG-RAN node Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate Downlink IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall use the received information when enforcing the maximum integrity protected data rate for the UE.
9.1.2.5 Location Information at S-NODE reporting IE Semantics: Indicates that the user’s Location Information at S-NODE is to be provided.

9.1.2.5 MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: Information used to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.2.33 MR-DC Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE is used to coordinate resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.33 E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: E-UTRA resource coordination information 9.2.2.34 E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The E-UTRA Resource Configuration Information IE indicates LTE resource allocation at ng-eNB used at the gNB to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN-node and S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.34 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: This IE indicates the sPCell. 9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

9.2.2.34 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.

The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. 9.2.2.34 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the assumed sPCell. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.35 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the sPCell. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.27 Global NG-RAN Cell Identity - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the PCell ID IE, the S-NG-RAN node may search for the target cell among the neighbour cells of the PCell indicated, as specified in the TS 37.340 [8].

The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received NE-DC TDM Pattern IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE.

9.2.2.38 Subframe Assignment IE Semantics: Indicates DL/UL subframe configuration where sa0 points to Configuration 0, sa1 to Configuration 1 etc. as specified in TS 36.331 [14].
9.2.2.38 Harq Offset IE Semantics: Indicates a HARQ subframe offset that is applied to the subframes designated as UL in the associated subframe assignment, see TS 36.331 [14]

9.1.2.5 Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE Semantics: Indicates that the resources for fast MCG recovery via SRB3 are requested. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. The M-NG-RAN node may request the S-NG-RAN node to configure the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The M-NG-RAN node may request the S-NG-RAN node to release the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the Available fast MCG recovery via SRB3 or the Release fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that the SRB3 is enabled or released.
└─Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release

9.1.2.5 Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE Semantics: Indicates that resources for fast MCG recovery via SRB3 are requested to be released. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - PDU session resources to be added within the PDU Session Resources To Be Added Item IE; - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE; - the S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE; - the Additional DRB IDs IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. The M-NG-RAN node may request the S-NG-RAN node to configure the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The M-NG-RAN node may request the S-NG-RAN node to release the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the Available fast MCG recovery via SRB3 or the Release fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that the SRB3 is enabled or released.

section_list.name: S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message is sent by the S-NG-RAN node to confirm the M-NG-RAN node's request to modify the S-NG-RAN node resources for a specific UE.
Direction: S-NG-RAN node ? M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.6 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.6 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
│  ├─PDU Session Resources Admitted To Be Added List
│  │  └─PDU Session Resources Admitted To Be Added Item

9.1.2.6 PDU Session Resources Admitted To Be Added Item IE Semantics: NOTE: If neither the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info – SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info – MN terminated IE is present in a PDU Session Resources Admitted To Be Added Item IE, abnormal conditions as specified in clause 8.3.3.4 apply. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message including a PDU Session Resources Admitted To Be Added Item IE, containing neither the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - MN terminated IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall trigger the M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Release procedure indicating an appropriate cause.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│  │     ├─PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info – SN terminated

9.2.1.6 PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains the result of the addition of S-NG-RAN node resources related to a PDU session for DRBs configured with an SN terminated bearer option.
│  │     │  ├─DL NG-U UP TNL Information at NG-RAN

9.2.1.6 DL NG-U UP TNL Information at NG-RAN IE Semantics: S-NG-RAN node endpoint of the NG transport bearer. For delivery of DL PDUs. 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation For a PDU session resource to be modified which is configured with the SN terminated bearer option the S-NG-RAN node may include in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the DL NG-U UP TNL Information at NG-RAN IE.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the DRBs To Be Setup List IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that DRB.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.1.6 SN UL PDCP UP TNL Information IE Semantics: S-NG-RAN node endpoint(s) of a DRB’s Xn transport bearer at its PDCP resource. For delivery of UL PDUs.
9.2.3.5 QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be applied to a QoS flow.
9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.
9.2.3.8 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.5 GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
9.2.3.6 Notification Control IE Semantics: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.
9.2.3.5 Reflective QoS Attribute IE Semantics: Reflective QoS is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE applies to Non-GBR bearers only and is ignored otherwise.

9.2.3.5 Additional QoS flow Information IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "more likely", this indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise.
9.2.3.5 QoS Monitoring Request IE Semantics: Indicates to measure UL, or DL, or both UL/DL delays for the associated QoS flow.

9.2.1.6 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP SN length of the DRB. 9.2.3.63 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the DRBs To Be Setup List IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that DRB.
9.2.3.63 UL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for UL.
9.2.3.63 DL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for DL.

9.2.1.6 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode to be used in the assisting node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.

For delivery of UL PDUs in case of PDCP duplication. 9.2.3.76 UP Transport Parameters - Section Description: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

9.2.1.6 Duplication Activation IE Semantics: Information on the initial state of UL PDCP duplication 9.2.3.71 Duplication Activation - Section Description: The Duplication Activation IE indicates the initial status of UL PDCP duplication, i.e., whether UL PDCP Duplication is activated or not.

9.2.1.6 UL Configuration IE Semantics: Information about UL usage in the M-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.75 UL Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the corresponding node. 9.2.3.75 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the corresponding node.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.1.6 MCG requested GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE contains GBR QoS Flow Information necessary for the MCG part. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
9.2.3.6 Notification Control IE Semantics: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE for a QoS flow in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB.

9.2.1.16 Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains TNL information for the establishment of data forwarding tunnels towards the target NG-RAN node. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.

9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.

9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation For each bearer for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the S-NG-RAN node: - if applicable, the M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each bearer that it has decided to admit, the S-NG-RAN node may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. - the S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer.

9.2.1.17 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains information from a source NG-RAN node regarding per QoS flow proposed data forwarding and offloading. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data for the QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.

9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation For each bearer for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the S-NG-RAN node: - if applicable, the M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each bearer that it has decided to admit, the S-NG-RAN node may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. - the S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer.
9.2.1.17 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored. 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.
