When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

9.1.2.6 Location Information at S-NODE IE Semantics: Contains information to support localisation of the UE 9.2.3.25 Target Cell Global ID - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR CGI or an E-UTRA CGI. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NG-RAN node may include the Location Information at S-NODE IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, if respective information is available at the S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

9.1.2.6 MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: Information used to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.2.33 MR-DC Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE is used to coordinate resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.33 E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: E-UTRA resource coordination information 9.2.2.34 E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The E-UTRA Resource Configuration Information IE indicates LTE resource allocation at ng-eNB used at the gNB to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN-node and S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.34 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: This IE indicates the sPCell. 9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

9.2.2.34 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.34 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.34 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the assumed sPCell. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.36 E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the ng-eNB and used by the gNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.33 NR Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: NR resource coordination information 9.2.2.35 NR Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The NR Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the ng-eNB sPCell which are not available for use by the ng-eNB and is used at the ng-eNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.35 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the sPCell. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.35 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "sPCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "sPCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.35 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "sPCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "sPCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.35 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: Reference cell for UL Coordination Information IE and DL Coordination Information IE.

9.2.2.37 NR Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the gNB and used by the ng-eNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.
├─PDU Session Resources with Data Forwarding List
│  └─PDU Session Resources with Data Forwarding List – SN terminated
9.2.1.24 PDU Session List with data forwarding request info - Section Description: This IE contains a list of PDU session related data forwarding request information.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│     ├─Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node

9.2.1.17 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains information from a source NG-RAN node regarding per QoS flow proposed data forwarding and offloading. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data for the QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation For each bearer for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the S-NG-RAN node: - if applicable, the M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each bearer that it has decided to admit, the S-NG-RAN node may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. - the S-NG-RAN node may include for each bearer in the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer.
9.2.1.17 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored. 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.

9.2.3.95 UL Forwarding Proposal - Section Description: This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data for the QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The M-NG-RAN node may propose to apply forwarding of UL data when offloading QoS flows for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Info - SN terminated IE or PDU Session Resource Modification Response Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
│     │  └─Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List

9.2.1.17 Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE Semantics: Usage of the DRB IDs indicated in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE is specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.15 DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs containing information about the mapped QoS flows.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE for a QoS flow in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB.

9.2.1.15 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.

9.2.1.24 DRBs To Be Released List IE Semantics: Indicate the QoS flow mapping and RLC mode of the released DRBs. 9.2.1.15 DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs containing information about the mapped QoS flows. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The S-NG-RAN node may include the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE for a QoS flow in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that only the uplink or downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB.

9.2.1.15 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the M-NG-RAN node requests transfer of the PDCP hosting from the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node for a PDU session, in which case the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains an PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released List IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session Resources admitted to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. The the RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode that the S-NG-RAN node uses for the DRB.

9.2.3.72 RRC Config Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the type of RRC configuration used at the S-NG-RAN node. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN node applied a full configuration or delta configuration, e.g., as part of mobility procedure involving a change of DU, the S-NG-RAN node shall inform the M-NG-RAN node by including the RRC Config Indication IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message.
9.1.2.6 Available fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE Semantics: Indicates the fast MCG recovery via SRB3 is available.

9.1.2.6 Release fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE Semantics: Indicates the fast MCG recovery via SRB3 is released. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.2 Successful Operation The M-NG-RAN node may request the S-NG-RAN node to configure the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The M-NG-RAN node may request the S-NG-RAN node to release the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The S-NG-RAN node may include the Available fast MCG recovery via SRB3 or the Release fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that the SRB3 is enabled or released.

section_list.name: S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST REJECT
aoa:
This message is sent by the S-NG-RAN node to inform the M-NG-RAN node that the M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation has failed.
Direction: S-NG-RAN node ? M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.7 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.7 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the S-NG-RAN node does not admit any modification requested by the M-NG-RAN node, or a failure occurs during the M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation, the S-NG-RAN node shall send the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUEST REJECT message to the M-NG-RAN node. The message shall contain the Cause IE with an appropriate value.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)

9.2.3.3 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED
aoa:
This message is sent by the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node to request the modification of S-NG-RAN node resources for a specific UE.
Direction: S-NG-RAN node ? M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.8 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.8 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node, after having initiated the M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification procedure, receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall refuse the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification procedure with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. If the M-NG-RAN node has a Prepared S-NG-RAN node Modification and receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE message to the S-NG-RAN node with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.3 Unsuccessful Operation In case that the Required Number of DRB IDs IE was included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message and if the M-NG-RAN node is not able to provide additional DRB IDs, the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node, after having initiated the handover procedure, receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall refuse the S-NG-RAN node modification procedure with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)

9.2.3.74 PDCP Change Indication - Section Description: The PDCP Change Indication IE is used for S-NG-RAN node to either initiate the security key update or to request PDCP data recovery in M-NG-RAN node. The PDCP Change Indication IE is also used for M-NG-RAN node to request PDCP data recovery in S-NG-RAN node. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE. - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the Spare DRB IDs IE; - the Required Number of DRB IDs IE; - the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the M-NG-RAN node receives a S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message containing the PDCP Change Indication IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall act as specified in TS 37.340 [8].
│  │  └─Indication from S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node
ENUMERATED (S-NG-RAN node key update required, PDCP data recovery required, ...)

9.2.3.74 Indication from S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node IE Semantics: S-NG-RAN node key update required indicates that the security key in S-NG-RAN node needs to be updated. The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the M-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.
│     └─Indication from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node
9.2.3.74 Indication from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node IE Semantics: The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the S-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.
├─PDU Session Resources To Be Modified List
│  └─PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item

9.1.2.8 PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE Semantics: NOTE: If neither the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info – SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info – MN terminated IE is present in a PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE, abnormal conditions as specified in clause 8.3.4.4 apply. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE. - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the Spare DRB IDs IE; - the Required Number of DRB IDs IE; - the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message including a PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE, containing neither the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - MN terminated IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall fail the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification procedure indicating an appropriate cause.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│     ├─PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info – SN terminated

9.2.1.20 PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - SN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains PDU session resource information of an S-NG-RAN node initiated modification request of DRBs configured with an SN terminated bearer option.
│     │  ├─DL NG-U UP TNL Information at NG-RAN

9.2.1.20 DL NG-U UP TNL Information at NG-RAN IE Semantics: S-NG-RAN node endpoint of the NG-U transport bearer. For delivery of DL PDUs. 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
9.2.1.4 QoS Flow List with Cause - Section Description: This IE contains a list of QoS flows with a cause value.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node, after having initiated the M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification procedure, receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall refuse the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification procedure with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. If the M-NG-RAN node has a Prepared S-NG-RAN node Modification and receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE message to the S-NG-RAN node with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.3 Unsuccessful Operation In case that the Required Number of DRB IDs IE was included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message and if the M-NG-RAN node is not able to provide additional DRB IDs, the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node, after having initiated the handover procedure, receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall refuse the S-NG-RAN node modification procedure with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)
│     │  ├─Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node

9.2.1.20 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE Semantics: This IE only applies to QoS flows included in the QoS FlowS To Be Released List IE. 9.2.1.17 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains information from a source NG-RAN node regarding per QoS flow proposed data forwarding and offloading. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may also propose to apply forwarding of UL data for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message. The M-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets.
9.2.1.17 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored. 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.

9.2.3.95 UL Forwarding Proposal - Section Description: This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may also propose to apply forwarding of UL data for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message. The M-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
│     │  │  └─Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List

9.2.1.17 Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE Semantics: Usage of the DRB IDs indicated in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE is specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.15 DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs containing information about the mapped QoS flows.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE. - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the Spare DRB IDs IE; - the Required Number of DRB IDs IE; - the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE.

9.2.1.15 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains a PDU session resource to be released which is configured with the SCG bearer option within the PDU sessions to be released List - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall include the RLC Mode IE within the DRBs To Be Released List IE in the PDU Session to be released List - SN terminated IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message. The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC mode used in the S-NG-RAN node for the DRB.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.1.20 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP SN length of the DRB. 9.2.3.63 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer.
9.2.3.63 UL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for UL.
9.2.3.63 DL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for DL.

9.2.1.20 SN UL PDCP UP TNL Information IE Semantics: S-NG-RAN node endpoint(s) of a DRB’s Xn transport bearer at its PDCP resource. For delivery of UL PDUs. 9.2.3.76 UP Transport Parameters - Section Description: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].
9.2.3.5 QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be applied to a QoS flow.
9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.
9.2.3.8 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.5 GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
9.2.3.6 Notification Control IE Semantics: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

If the M-NG-RAN node has a Prepared S-NG-RAN node Modification and receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE message to the S-NG-RAN node with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.3 Unsuccessful Operation In case that the Required Number of DRB IDs IE was included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message and if the M-NG-RAN node is not able to provide additional DRB IDs, the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node, after having initiated the handover procedure, receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall refuse the S-NG-RAN node modification procedure with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.
