9.1.2.8 S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-Config message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10]. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE. - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the Spare DRB IDs IE; - the Required Number of DRB IDs IE; - the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE.

9.1.2.8 Spare DRB IDs IE Semantics: Indicates the list of unnecessary DRB IDs that had been used by the S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE. - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the Spare DRB IDs IE; - the Required Number of DRB IDs IE; - the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the M-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message containing the Spare DRB IDs IE, the M-NG-RAN node may take those into consideration to be used for MN-terminated bearers.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.1.2.8 Required Number of DRB IDs IE Semantics: Indicates the number of DRB IDs that the S-NG-RAN node requests more. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE. - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the Spare DRB IDs IE; - the Required Number of DRB IDs IE; - the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the M-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message containing the Required Number of DRB IDs IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall provide new DRB IDs to be used by the S-NG-RAN node for SN-terminated bearers , if such DRB IDs are available, in the Additional DRB IDs IE included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.3 Unsuccessful Operation In case that the Required Number of DRB IDs IE was included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message and if the M-NG-RAN node is not able to provide additional DRB IDs, the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

9.1.2.8 Location Information at S-NODE IE Semantics: Contains information to support localisation of the UE 9.2.3.25 Target Cell Global ID - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR CGI or an E-UTRA CGI.
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

9.1.2.8 MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: Information used to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.2.33 MR-DC Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE is used to coordinate resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation The S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE. - PDU session resources to be modified within the PDU Session Resources To Be Modified Item IE; - PDU session resources to be released within the PDU Session Resources To Be Released Item IE; - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the Spare DRB IDs IE; - the Required Number of DRB IDs IE; - the QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE; - the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE. If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.33 E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: E-UTRA resource coordination information 9.2.2.34 E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The E-UTRA Resource Configuration Information IE indicates LTE resource allocation at ng-eNB used at the gNB to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN-node and S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.34 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: This IE indicates the sPCell. 9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

9.2.2.34 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.34 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.34 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the assumed sPCell. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.36 E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the ng-eNB and used by the gNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.33 NR Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: NR resource coordination information 9.2.2.35 NR Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The NR Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the ng-eNB sPCell which are not available for use by the ng-eNB and is used at the ng-eNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.35 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the sPCell. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.35 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "sPCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "sPCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.35 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "sPCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "sPCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.35 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: Reference cell for UL Coordination Information IE and DL Coordination Information IE.

9.2.2.37 NR Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the gNB and used by the ng-eNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the S-NG-RAN node. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The M-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node.

9.2.3.72 RRC Config Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the type of RRC configuration used at the S-NG-RAN node. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN node applied a full configuration or delta configuration, e.g., as part of mobility procedure involving a change of DU, the S-NG-RAN node shall inform the M-NG-RAN node by including the RRC Config Indication IE in the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message.

section_list.name: S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM
aoa:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN node to inform the S-NG-RAN node about the successful modification.
Direction: M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.9 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.9 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
├─PDU sessions Admitted To Be Modified List
│  └─PDU sessions Admitted To Be Modified Item

9.1.2.9 PDU sessions Admitted To Be Modified Item IE Semantics: NOTE: If neither the PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info – SN terminated IE nor the PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info – MN terminated IE is present in a PDU Session Resources Admitted To Be Modified Item IE, abnormal conditions as specified in clause 8.3.4.4 apply.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│     ├─PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info – SN terminated

9.2.1.21 PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info - SN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains the PDU session resource related result of an S-NG-RAN node initiated modification of DRBs configured with an SN terminated bearer option.
│     │  ├─UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF

9.2.1.21 UL NG-U UP TNL Information at UPF IE Semantics: UPF endpoint of the NG-U transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
│     │  ├─DRBs Admitted to be Setup or Modified List
│     │  │  └─DRBs Admitted to be Setup or Modified Item
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.1.21 MN DL CG UP TNL Information IE Semantics: M-NG-RAN node endpoint(s) of the DRB’s Xn transport at its Lower Layer CG resource. For delivery of DL PDUs. 9.2.3.76 UP Transport Parameters - Section Description: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].
│     │  │     ├─secondary MN DL CG UP TNL Information

9.2.1.21 secondary MN DL CG UP TNL Information IE Semantics: M-NG-RAN node endpoint(s) of the DRB’s Xn transport at its Lower Layer CG resource. For delivery of DL PDUs at the case of PDCP duplication. 9.2.3.76 UP Transport Parameters - Section Description: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

9.2.1.21 LCID IE Semantics: LCID for primary path if PDCP duplication is applied. 9.2.3.70 LCID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies a logical channel ID for the associated DRB. 9.2.3.70 LCID IE Semantics: Corresponds to the LogicalChannelIdentity defined in TS 38.331 [10].
│     │  ├─DRBs Not Admitted To Be Setup or Modified List
9.2.1.28 DRB List with Cause - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs, a cause may accompany each list element.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)

9.2.1.28 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB.
│     │  ├─Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node

9.2.1.21 Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE Semantics: Forwarding Addresses for both, QoS flow and DRB level offloading. 9.2.1.16 Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains TNL information for the establishment of data forwarding tunnels towards the target NG-RAN node. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may also propose to apply forwarding of UL data for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message. The M-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
│     │  │  ├─QoS Flows Accepted For Data Forwarding List
│     │  │  │  └─QoS Flows Accepted For Data Forwarding Item

In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may also propose to apply forwarding of UL data for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message. 9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.1.21 DRB IDs taken into use IE Semantics: Indicating the DRB IDs taken into use by the target NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message includes the DRB IDs taken into use IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if applicable, act as specified in TS 37.340 [8]
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
│     └─PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info – MN terminated

9.2.1.23 PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info - MN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains the PDU session resource related result of an S-NG-RAN node initiated modification of DRBs configured with an MN terminated bearer option. NOTE: In the current version of this specification, this IE has no content, apart from an extension container.
9.2.1.25 PDU Session List with data forwarding info from the target node - Section Description: This IE contains a list of PDU session related data forwarding information from the target NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│  │  ├─Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node

9.2.1.16 Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains TNL information for the establishment of data forwarding tunnels towards the target NG-RAN node. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may also propose to apply forwarding of UL data for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message. The M-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session Level UL Data Forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.
│  │  │  ├─QoS Flows Accepted For Data Forwarding List
│  │  │  │  └─QoS Flows Accepted For Data Forwarding Item
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│  │  │  ├─PDU Session level DL data forwarding UP TNL Information

9.2.1.16 PDU Session level DL data forwarding UP TNL Information IE Semantics: To forward NG-U DL SDAP SDUs to the target node. 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
│  │  │  ├─PDU Session level UL data forwarding UP TNL Information

9.2.1.16 PDU Session level UL data forwarding UP TNL Information IE Semantics: To forward NG-U UL SDAP SDU to the target node. 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the QoS flows To Be Released List within the PDU Session Resource Modification Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node may also propose to apply forwarding of UL data for which in-order delivery is requested by including the UL Forwarding Proposal IE in the Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Required Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message. The M-NG-RAN node may include the PDU Session level UL data forwarding UP TNL Information IE in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE within the PDU Session Resource Modification Confirm Info - SN terminated IE of the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.1.25 DRB IDs taken into use IE Semantics: Indicating the DRB IDs taken into use by the target NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message includes the DRB IDs taken into use IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if applicable, act as specified in TS 37.340 [8]
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.1.27 PDU Session List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of PDU sessions.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.1.2.9 M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE Semantics: Includes the RRCReconfigurationComplete message as defined in subclause 6.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10] or the RRCConnectionReconfigurationComplete message as defined in subclause 6.2.2 of TS 36.331 [14]. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the M-NG-RAN node is able to perform the modifications requested by the S-NG-RAN node, the M-NG-RAN node shall send the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message to the S-NG-RAN node. The S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message may contain the M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE.

9.1.2.9 Additional DRB IDs IE Semantics: Indicates additional list of DRB IDs that the S-NG-RAN node may use for SN-terminated bearers. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the M-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message containing the Required Number of DRB IDs IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall provide new DRB IDs to be used by the S-NG-RAN node for SN-terminated bearers , if such DRB IDs are available, in the Additional DRB IDs IE included in the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.3.3 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

9.1.2.9 MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: Information used to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.2.33 MR-DC Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE is used to coordinate resource utilisation between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.33 E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: E-UTRA resource coordination information 9.2.2.34 E-UTRA Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The E-UTRA Resource Configuration Information IE indicates LTE resource allocation at ng-eNB used at the gNB to coordinate resource utilisation between M-NG-RAN-node and S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.34 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: This IE indicates the sPCell. 9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

9.2.2.34 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.34 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.34 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the assumed sPCell. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.36 E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the ng-eNB and used by the gNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.33 NR Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: NR resource coordination information 9.2.2.35 NR Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The NR Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the ng-eNB sPCell which are not available for use by the ng-eNB and is used at the ng-eNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.35 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the sPCell. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.35 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "sPCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "sPCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  . is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.35 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "sPCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "sPCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [26]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.35 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: Reference cell for UL Coordination Information IE and DL Coordination Information IE.

9.2.2.37 NR Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the gNB and used by the ng-eNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the gNB and the ng-eNB. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the M-NG-RAN node. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received UL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The S-NG-RAN node shall consider the value of the received DL Coordination Information IE valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the E-UTRA Coordination Assistance Information IE or the NR Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MR-DC Resource Coordination Information IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the S-NG-RAN node and the M-NG-RAN node.

section_list.name: S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN node to inform the S-NG-RAN node that the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification has failed.
Direction: M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.10 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.10 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol. 8.3.3 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification Preparation 8.3.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node has a Prepared S-NG-RAN node Modification and receives the S-NODE MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE message to the S-NG-RAN node with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. 8.3.4 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Modification 8.3.4.3 Unsuccessful Operation In case the requested modification cannot be performed successfully the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE MODIFICATION REFUSE message to the S-NG-RAN node with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)
9.1.2.10 M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

9.2.3.3 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: S-NODE CHANGE REQUIRED
aoa:
This message is sent by the S-NG-RAN node to the M-NG-RAN node to trigger the change of the S-NG-RAN node.
Direction: S-NG-RAN node ? M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.11 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.11 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.2.2.3 Global NG-RAN Node ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NG-RAN node (see TS 38.300 [9]). 8.3.5 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change 8.3.5.2 Successful Operation The S-NG-RAN node initiates the procedure by sending the S-NODE CHANGE REQUIRED message to the M-NG-RAN node including the Target S-NG-RAN node ID IE. When the S-NG-RAN node sends the S-NODE CHANGE REQUIRED message, it shall start the timer TXnDCoverall.
9.2.2.1 Global gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify a gNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.1 gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.
9.2.2.2 Global ng-eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.2 Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Short Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Long Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol. 8.3.5 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change 8.3.5.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node, after having initiated the Handover Preparation procedure, receives the S-NODE CHANGE REQUIRED message, the M-NG-RAN node shall refuse the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change procedure with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)

9.1.2.11 PDU Session SN Change Required Item IE Semantics: NOTE: If the PDU Session Resource Change Required Info – SN terminated IE is not present in a PDU Session SN Change Required Item IE, abnormal conditions as specified in clause 8.3.5.4 apply. 8.3.5 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change 8.3.5.4 Abnormal Conditions If the M-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE CHANGE REQUIRED message including a PDU Session SN Change Required Item IE, not containing the PDU Session Resource Change Required Info - SN terminated IE, the M-NG-RAN node shall fail the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change procedure indicating an appropriate cause.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│     └─PDU Session Resource Change Required Info – SN terminated

9.2.1.18 PDU Session Resource Change Required Info - SN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains information for the S-NG-RAN node initiated request for an S-NG-RAN node change related to a PDU session resource with DRBs configured with an SN terminated bearer option.
│        └─Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node

9.2.1.17 Data Forwarding and Offloading Info from source NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains information from a source NG-RAN node regarding per QoS flow proposed data forwarding and offloading.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets.
9.2.1.17 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored. 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.
9.2.3.95 UL Forwarding Proposal - Section Description: This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.
│           └─Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List

9.2.1.17 Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE Semantics: Usage of the DRB IDs indicated in the Source DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List IE is specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.15 DRB to QoS Flow Mapping List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs containing information about the mapped QoS flows.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB

9.2.1.15 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode for PDCP transfer between M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB.
9.1.2.11 S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-Config message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

section_list.name: S-NODE CHANGE CONFIRM
aoa:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN node to inform the S-NG-RAN node that the preparation of the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node change was successful.
Direction: M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.12 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.12 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.12 PDU Session SN Change Confirm Item IE Semantics: NOTE: If the PDU Session Resource Change Confirm Info – SN terminated IE is not present in a PDU Session SN Change Confirm Item IE, abnormal conditions as specified in clause 8.3.5.4 apply. 8.3.5 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change 8.3.5.4 Abnormal Conditions If the S-NG-RAN node receives an S-NODE CHANGE CONFIRM message including a PDU Session SN Change Confirm Item IE, not containing the PDU Session Resource Change Confirm Info - SN terminated IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall trigger the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Release procedure indicating an appropriate cause.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│     └─PDU Session Resource Change Confirm Info – SN terminated

9.2.1.19 PDU Session Resource Change Confirm Info - SN terminated - Section Description: This IE contains information for the M-NG-RAN node's confirmation of an S-NG-RAN node initiated request for an S-NG-RAN node change related to a PDU session resource with DRBs configured with an SN terminated bearer option.
│        ├─Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node

9.2.1.16 Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node - Section Description: This IE contains TNL information for the establishment of data forwarding tunnels towards the target NG-RAN node. 8.3.5 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change 8.3.5.2 Successful Operation If the M-NG-RAN node is able to perform the change requested by the S-NG-RAN node, the M-NG-RAN node shall send the S-NODE CHANGE CONFIRM message to the S-NG-RAN node. For DRBs configured with the PDCP entity in the S-NG-RAN node, the M-NG-RAN node may include data forwarding related information in the Data Forwarding Info from target NG-RAN node IE.
│        │  ├─QoS Flows Accepted For Data Forwarding List
│        │  │  └─QoS Flows Accepted For Data Forwarding Item
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│        │  ├─PDU Session level DL data forwarding UP TNL Information

9.2.1.16 PDU Session level DL data forwarding UP TNL Information IE Semantics: To forward NG-U DL SDAP SDUs to the target node. 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
│        │  ├─PDU Session level UL data forwarding UP TNL Information

9.2.1.16 PDU Session level UL data forwarding UP TNL Information IE Semantics: To forward NG-U UL SDAP SDU to the target node. 9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.1.19 DRB IDs taken into use IE Semantics: Indicating the DRB IDs taken into use by the target NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.3.5 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change 8.3.5.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE CHANGE CONFIRM message includes the DRB IDs taken into use IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if applicable, act as specified in TS 37.340 [8].
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.3.3 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: S-NODE CHANGE REFUSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN node to inform the S-NG-RAN node that the preparation of the S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node change has failed.
Direction: M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.13 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
