The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol. 8.3.5 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Change 8.3.5.3 Unsuccessful Operation In case the request modification cannot accept the request to change the S-NG-RAN node the M-NG-RAN node shall respond with the S-NODE CHANGE REFUSE message to the S-NG-RAN node with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

9.2.3.68 UE Context Kept Indicator - Section Description: This IE indicates whether the UE Context is kept at the S-NG-RAN node in case of an M-NG-RAN node handover without S-NG-RAN node change. 8.2.7 UE Context Release 8.2.7.2 Successful Operation The S-NG-RAN node may receive the S-NODE RELEASE REQUEST message including the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True", upon which the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, only release the resources related to the UE-associated signalling connection between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 8.3.6 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Release 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the S-NODE RELEASE REQUEST message containing UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True", the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, only initiate the release of the resources related to the UE-associated signalling connection between the M-NG-RAN node and the S-NG-RAN node. If the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" and the DRBs transferred to MN IE are included in the S-NODE RELEASE REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status for the listed DRBs, as specified in TS 37.340 [8].
9.1.2.14 M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10].

9.1.2.14 DRBs transferred to MN IE Semantics: Indicates that the target M-NG-RAN node reconfigured the listed DRBs as MN-terminated bearers. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.3.6 M-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Release 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" and the DRBs transferred to MN IE are included in the S-NODE RELEASE REQUEST message, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if supported, provide the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status for the listed DRBs, as specified in TS 37.340 [8].
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.

9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

9.2.1.25 DRB IDs taken into use IE Semantics: Indicating the DRB IDs taken into use by the target NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. 9.2.1.29 DRB List - Section Description: This IE contains a list of DRBs. 8.3.7 S-NG-RAN node initiated S-NG-RAN node Release 8.3.7.2 Successful Operation If the S-NODE RELEASE CONFIRM message includes the DRB IDs taken into use IE, the S-NG-RAN node shall, if applicable, act as specified in TS 37.340 [8].
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.

9.2.3.3 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: S-NODE COUNTER CHECK REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the S-NG-RAN node to request the verification of the value of the PDCP COUNTs associated with SN terminated bearers established in the S-NG-RAN node.
Direction: S-NG-RAN node ? M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.19 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.19 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
9.2.3.33 DRB ID - Section Description: This IE contains the DRB ID.
9.1.2.19 UL COUNT IE Semantics: Indicates the value of uplink COUNT associated to this DRB.
9.1.2.19 DL COUNT IE Semantics: Indicates the value of downlink COUNT associated to this DRB.

section_list.name: RRC TRANSFER
aoa:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN-NODE to the S-NG-RAN-NODE to transfer an RRC message or from the S-NG-RAN-NODE to the M-NG-RAN-NODE to report the DL RRC message delivery status.
Direction: M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node or S-NG-RAN node ? M-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.20 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.20 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

9.1.2.20 RRC Container IE Semantics: Contains a PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] or TS 36.331 [14] and ciphered with the key of the M-NG-RAN node 8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.
9.1.2.20 SRB Type IE Semantics: The SRB type to be used

9.1.2.20 Delivery Status IE Semantics: DL RRC delivery status of split SRB 9.2.3.45 Delivery Status - Section Description: This IE provides the delivery status of RRC PDUs provided by RRC Transfer message. 9.2.3.45 Delivery Status IE Semantics: Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP SN, as defined in TS 38.323 [11]. 8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

9.1.2.20 RRC Container IE Semantics: For NGEN-DC and NR-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] containing the MeasurementReport message or the FailureInformation message. For NE-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 36.331 [14] containing the MeasurementReport message. 8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.
├─Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN

8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

9.1.2.20 RRC Container IE Semantics: For NR-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] containing the MCGFailureInformation, message. For NGEN-DC, includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 36.331 [14] containing the MCGFailureInformation message. 8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.
└─Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN

8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

9.1.2.20 RRC Container IE Semantics: For NR-DC, includes the DL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [10] containing the RRCReconfiguration or RRCRelease message. For NGEN-DC, includes the DL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 36.331 [14] containing the RRCConnectionReconfiguration or RRCConnectionRelease message. 8.3.9 RRC Transfer 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in the NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall ignore the message. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the S-NG-RAN-NODE receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, the S-NG-RAN-NODE shall deliver the contained RRC container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

section_list.name: NOTIFICATION CONTROL INDICATION
aoa:
This message is sent to notify that the QoS requirements of already established GBR QoS flow(s) for a given UE for which notification control has been requested are either not fulfilled anymore or fulfilled again.
Direction: S-NG-RAN node ? M-NG-RAN node and M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.21 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.21 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.57 QoS Flow Notification Control Indication Info - Section Description: This IE provides information about QoS flows of a PDU Session Resource for which notification control has been requested.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

section_list.name: ACTIVITY NOTIFICATION
aoa:
This message is sent by a NG-RAN node to send notification to another NG-RAN node for one or several QoS flows or PDU sessions already established for a given UE.
Direction: NG-RAN node ? NG-RAN node
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.22 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.22 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
├─UE Context level user plane activity report

9.2.3.59 User plane traffic activity report - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic activity. 9.2.3.59 User plane traffic activity report IE Semantics: "re-activated" is only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object 8.3.11 Activity Notification 8.3.11.2 Successful Operation The ACTIVITY NOTIFICATION message may contain one or more of the below: - notification for UE context level user plane activity in the UE Context level user plane activity report IE. - notification of user plane activity for the already established PDU sessions within the PDU Session Resource Activity Notify List IE. - notification of user plane activity for the already established QoS flows within the PDU Session Resource Activity Notify List IE. - notification of RAN Paging failure.

8.3.11 Activity Notification 8.3.11.2 Successful Operation The ACTIVITY NOTIFICATION message may contain one or more of the below: - notification for UE context level user plane activity in the UE Context level user plane activity report IE. - notification of user plane activity for the already established PDU sessions within the PDU Session Resource Activity Notify List IE. - notification of user plane activity for the already established QoS flows within the PDU Session Resource Activity Notify List IE. - notification of RAN Paging failure.
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
│     ├─PDU Session level user plane activity report

9.2.3.59 User plane traffic activity report - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic activity. 9.2.3.59 User plane traffic activity report IE Semantics: "re-activated" is only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.59 User plane traffic activity report - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic activity. 9.2.3.59 User plane traffic activity report IE Semantics: "re-activated" is only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object

8.3.11 Activity Notification 8.3.11.2 Successful Operation If the ACTIVITY NOTIFICATION message contains the RAN Paging Failure IE, NG-RAN node2 shall consider that RAN Paging has failed in NG-RAN node1 for the UE. NG-RAN node2 may discard the user plane data for that UE and consider that the UE context is unchanged.

section_list.name: E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST
aoa: E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST

This message is sent by a neighbouring ng-eNB to a peer gNB or by a neighbouring gNB to a peer ng-eNB, both nodes able to interact, to express the desired resource allocation for data traffic, for the sake of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
Direction: ng-eNB ? gNB, gNB ? ng-eNB.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.23 Data Traffic Resource Indication IE Semantics: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic. 9.2.2.30 Data Traffic Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 8.3.12 E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination 8.3.12.2 Successful Operation An ng-eNB initiates the procedure by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message to an gNB over the X2 interface. The gNB extracts the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and it replies by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message. The gNB shall calculate the full ng-eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.30 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value “0” indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value “1” indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value “0” indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value “1” indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value “0” indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value “1” indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.2.30 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold. 9.2.2.32 Reserved Subframe Pattern - Section Description: The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.
9.2.2.32 Subframe Type IE Semantics: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

9.2.2.32 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates “regular subframe”. Value ‘1’ indicates “reserved subframe”. For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.32 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.1.2.23 Spectrum Sharing Group ID IE Semantics: Indicates the E-UTRA cells involved in resource coordination with the NR cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.
│  │  └─List of E-UTRA Cells in E-UTRA Coordination Request
9.1.2.23 List of E-UTRA Cells in E-UTRA Coordination Request IE Semantics: List of applicable E-UTRA cells.
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

9.1.2.23 Data Traffic Resource Indication IE Semantics: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic. 9.2.2.30 Data Traffic Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 8.3.12 E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination 8.3.12.2 Successful Operation An ng-eNB initiates the procedure by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message to an gNB over the X2 interface. The gNB extracts the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and it replies by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message. The gNB shall calculate the full ng-eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.30 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value “0” indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value “1” indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.2.31 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.2.30 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold. 9.2.2.32 Reserved Subframe Pattern - Section Description: The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.
9.2.2.32 Subframe Type IE Semantics: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

9.2.2.32 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates “regular subframe”. Value ‘1’ indicates “reserved subframe”. For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.32 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
│     ├─List of E-UTRA Cells in NR Coordination Request
9.1.2.23 List of E-UTRA Cells in NR Coordination Request IE Semantics: List of applicable E-UTRA cells
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).
9.1.2.23 Spectrum Sharing Group ID IE Semantics: Indicates the NR cells involved in resource coordination with the E-UTRA cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.
│     └─List of NR Cells in NR Coordination Request

9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. 9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.39 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the XnAP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an Xn-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.3.12 E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination 8.3.12.2 Successful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared Xn-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 38.300 [9], the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message and the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.

section_list.name: E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE
aoa: E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE

This message is sent by a neighbouring ng-eNB to a peer gNB or by a neighbouring gNB to a peer ng-eNB, both nodes able to interact, as a response to the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST.
Direction: ng-eNB ? gNB, gNB ? ng-eNB.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

The gNB extracts the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and it replies by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message. The gNB shall calculate the full ng-eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the ng-eNB.

section_list.name: SECONDARY RAT DATA USAGE REPORT
aoa:
This message is sent by the S-NG-RAN node to report data volumes for secondary RAT.
Direction: S-NG-RAN node ? M-NG-RAN node
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.25 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.25 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
└─PDU Session Resource Secondary RAT Usage List
└─PDU Session Resource Secondary RAT Usage Item
9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID - Section Description: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.87 Secondary RAT Usage Information - Section Description: This IE provides information on the Secondary RAT resources used by a PDU Session with MR-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [8].
9.2.3.88 Volume Timed Report List - Section Description: This IE provides information on the data usage.

9.2.3.88 Start Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

9.2.3.88 End Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count UL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count DL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.88 Volume Timed Report List - Section Description: This IE provides information on the data usage.

9.2.3.88 Start Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

9.2.3.88 End Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count UL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count DL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.

section_list.name: TRACE START
aoa:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN node to initiate a trace session for a UE.
Direction: M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.26 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.26 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.
9.2.3.55 Trace Activation - Section Description: This IE defines parameters related to a trace activation.

9.2.3.97 NG-RAN Trace ID - Section Description: This IE defines the NG-RAN Trace ID. 9.2.3.97 NG-RAN Trace ID IE Semantics: This IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information encoded as in 9.2.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (last 2 octets).

9.2.3.55 Interfaces To Trace IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an NG-RAN node interface: first bit = NG-C, second bit = Xn-C, third bit = Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1: other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.
ENUMERATED (minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, …)
9.2.3.55 Trace Depth IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.422 [23].
9.2.3.55 Trace Collection Entity IP Address IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.422 [23] 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.

section_list.name: DEACTIVATE TRACE
aoa:
This message is sent by the M-NG-RAN node to deactivate a trace session.
Direction: M-NG-RAN node ? S-NG-RAN node

9.1.2.27 M-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the M-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.27 S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID - Section Description: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

9.1.2.27 NG-RAN Trace ID IE Semantics: As per NG-RAN Trace ID in Trace Activation IE 8.3.15 Deactivate Trace 8.3.15.2 Successful Operation The Deactivate Trace procedure is initiated by the M-NG-RAN by sending the DEACTIVATE TRACE to the S-NG-RAN for that specific UE. Upon reception of the DEACTIVATE TRACE message, the S-NG-RAN shall stop the trace session for the indicated trace reference in the NG-RAN Trace ID IE.

section_list.name: XN SETUP REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by a NG-RAN node to a neighbouring NG-RAN node to transfer application data for an Xn-C interface instance.
Direction: NG-RAN node1 --> NG-RAN node2.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.2.3 Global NG-RAN Node ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NG-RAN node (see TS 38.300 [9]).
9.2.2.1 Global gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify a gNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.1 gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.
9.2.2.2 Global ng-eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.2 Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Short Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Long Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

9.1.3.1 TAI Support List IE Semantics: List of supported TAs and associated characteristics. 9.2.3.20 TAI Support List - Section Description: This IE indicates the list of TAIs supported by NG-RAN node and associated characteristics e.g. supported slices.
9.2.3.20 TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast TAC 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

9.2.3.20 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMN 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.20 TAI Slice Support List IE Semantics: Supported S-NSSAIs per TA 9.2.3.22 Slice Support List - Section Description: This IE indicates the list of supported slices.
9.2.3.21 S-NSSAI - Section Description: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

9.1.3.1 AMF Region Information IE Semantics: Contains a list of all the AMF Regions to which the NG-RAN node belongs. 9.2.3.83 AMF Region Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the Global AMF Region IDs of the AMF Regions to which the NG-RAN node belongs. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation The AMF Region Information IE in the XN SETUP REQUEST message shall contain a complete list of Global AMF Region IDs to which the NG-RAN node1 belongs. The AMF Region Information IE in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message shall contain a complete list of Global AMF Region IDs to which the NG-RAN node2 belongs.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.1.3.1 List of Served Cells NR IE Semantics: Contains a list of cells served by the gNB. If a partial list of cells is signalled, it contains at least one cell per carrier configured at the gNB 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation The List of Served Cells NR IE and the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE, if contained in the XN SETUP REQUEST message, shall contain a complete list of cells served by NG-RAN node1 or, if supported, a partial list of served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE. The List of Served Cells NR IE and the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE, if contained in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message, shall contain a complete list of cells served by NG-RAN node2 or, if supported, a partial list of served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE. If the Partial List Indicator NR IE or the Partial List Indicator NR IE is set to "partial" in the XN SETUP REQUEST message the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall, if supported, assume that the List of Served Cells NR IE or the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE in the XN SETUP REQUEST message includes a partial list of cells.
9.2.2.11 Served Cell Information NR - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbouring NG-RAN node may need for the Xn AP interface.
9.2.2.11 NR-PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.11 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.
9.2.2.11 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. 9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Info - Section Description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD or for SUL carrier.

9.2.2.19 NR ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

9.2.2.18 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE contains information about the SUL carrier. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node1, the NG-RAN node1 shall include in the XN SETUP REQUEST message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.

9.2.2.18 SUL Frequency Info IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.2.20 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.2.20 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

9.1.3.1 List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE Semantics: Contains a list of cells served by the ng-eNB. If a partial list of cells is signalled, it contains at least one cell per carrier configured at the ng-eNB 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation The List of Served Cells NR IE and the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE, if contained in the XN SETUP REQUEST message, shall contain a complete list of cells served by NG-RAN node1 or, if supported, a partial list of served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE. The List of Served Cells NR IE and the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE, if contained in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message, shall contain a complete list of cells served by NG-RAN node2 or, if supported, a partial list of served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE. If the Partial List Indicator NR IE or the Partial List Indicator NR IE is set to "partial" in the XN SETUP REQUEST message the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall, if supported, assume that the List of Served Cells NR IE or the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE in the XN SETUP REQUEST message includes a partial list of cells.

9.2.2.12 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.2.29 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
9.2.2.29 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.2.29 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.2.29 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.2.29 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.2.29 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all “1”s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value “0” indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value “1” indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value “1” corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.2.29 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.2.29 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

9.1.3.1 Partial List Indicator NR IE Semantics: Value “partial” indicates that a partial list of cells is included in the List of Served Cells NR IE. 9.2.2.46 Partial List Indicator - Section Description: The Partial List Indicator IE is used by the NG-RAN node to indicate whether the served cell information contained in the same message is a partial list. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the Partial List Indicator NR IE or the Partial List Indicator NR IE is set to "partial" in the XN SETUP REQUEST message the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall, if supported, assume that the List of Served Cells NR IE or the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE in the XN SETUP REQUEST message includes a partial list of cells.

9.1.3.1 Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE Semantics: Contains NR cell related assistance information. 9.2.2.41 Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR - Section Description: The Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about NR cells and it includes information about cell list size capacity. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE or the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE is present in the XN SETUP REQUEST message the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall, if supported, use it when generating the list of NG-RAN served cell information to include in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message.

9.2.2.44 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given cell list. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the Message Oversize Notification IE is included in the XN SETUP FAILURE, the initiating node shall, if supported, deduce that the failure is due to a too large XN SETUP REQUEST message and ensure that the total number of served cells in following XN SETUP REQUEST message is equal to or lower than the value of the Maximum Cell List Size IE.
9.2.2.17 Cell Assistance Information NR - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about NR cells.
9.2.2.17 List of Requested NR Cells IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests a limited list of served NR cells.
9.2.2.17 NR CGI IE Semantics: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.17 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests the complete list of served cells for a gNB

9.1.3.1 Partial List Indicator E-UTRA IE Semantics: Value “partial” indicates that a partial list of cells is included in the List of Served Cells E-UTRA. 9.2.2.46 Partial List Indicator - Section Description: The Partial List Indicator IE is used by the NG-RAN node to indicate whether the served cell information contained in the same message is a partial list.

9.1.3.1 Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE Semantics: Contains E-UTRA cell related assistance information. 9.2.2.43 Cell Assistance Information E-UTRA - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about E-UTRA cells. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE or the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE is present in the XN SETUP REQUEST message the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall, if supported, use it when generating the list of NG-RAN served cell information to include in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message.
9.2.2.43 List of Requested E-UTRA Cells IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests a limited list of served E-UTRA cells.

9.2.2.43 E-UTRA CGI IE Semantics: E-UTRA cell for which served E-UTRA cell information is requested. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.43 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests the complete list of served cells for a ng-eNB

section_list.name: XN SETUP RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by a NG-RAN node to a neighbouring NG-RAN node to transfer application data for an Xn-C interface instance.
Direction: NG-RAN node2 --> NG-RAN node1.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.2.3 Global NG-RAN Node ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NG-RAN node (see TS 38.300 [9]).
9.2.2.1 Global gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify a gNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.1 gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.
9.2.2.2 Global ng-eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.2 Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Short Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Long Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

9.1.3.2 TAI Support List IE Semantics: List of supported TAs and associated characteristics. 9.2.3.20 TAI Support List - Section Description: This IE indicates the list of TAIs supported by NG-RAN node and associated characteristics e.g. supported slices.
9.2.3.20 TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast TAC 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

9.2.3.20 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMN 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.20 TAI Slice Support List IE Semantics: Supported S-NSSAIs per TA 9.2.3.22 Slice Support List - Section Description: This IE indicates the list of supported slices.
9.2.3.21 S-NSSAI - Section Description: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

9.1.3.2 List of Served Cells NR IE Semantics: Contains a list of cells served by the gNB. If a partial list of cells is signalled, it contains at least one cell per carrier configured at the gNB 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation The List of Served Cells NR IE and the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE, if contained in the XN SETUP REQUEST message, shall contain a complete list of cells served by NG-RAN node1 or, if supported, a partial list of served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE. The List of Served Cells NR IE and the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE, if contained in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message, shall contain a complete list of cells served by NG-RAN node2 or, if supported, a partial list of served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE. If the Partial List Indicator NR IE or the Partial List Indicator NR IE is set to "partial" in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message from the candidate NG-RAN node2, the NG-RAN node1 shall, if supported, assume that the List of Served Cells NR IE or the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message includes a partial list of cells.
9.2.2.11 Served Cell Information NR - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbouring NG-RAN node may need for the Xn AP interface.
9.2.2.11 NR-PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.11 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.
9.2.2.11 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Info - Section Description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD or for SUL carrier.

9.2.2.19 NR ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

9.2.2.18 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE contains information about the SUL carrier. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node2, the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall include in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.

9.2.2.18 SUL Frequency Info IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.2.20 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.2.20 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)

9.2.2.20 NR NRB IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [24]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks “NRB” 11, 18, etc.
9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Band IE Semantics: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node2, the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall include in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.

9.2.2.40 Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR - Section Description: This IE contains the subcarrier spacing, cyclic prefix and TDD DL-UL slot configuration of an NR cell that a neighbour NG-RAN node needs to take into account for cross-link interference mitigation, when operating its own cells. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is included in the XN SETUP REQUEST or XN SETUP RESPONSE message, the receiving NG-RAN node should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the sending NG-RAN node. The receiving NG-RAN node shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of an update of the IE for the same cell(s).
9.2.2.40 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].
9.2.2.40 NR Cyclic Prefix IE Semantics: The type of cyclic prefix, which determines the number of symbols in a slot.
ENUMERATED (ms0p5, ms0p625, ms1, ms1p25, ms2, ms2p5, ms3, ms4, ms5, ms10, ms20, ms40, ms60, ms80, ms100, ms120, ms140, ms160, …)
9.2.2.40 NR DL-UL Transmission Periodicity IE Semantics: The periodicity is expressed in the format msXpYZ, and equals X.YZ milliseconds.
9.2.2.40 Number of DL Symbols IE Semantics: Number of consecutive DL symbols at the beginning of the slot identified by Slot Index. If extended cyclic prefix is used, the maximum value is 11.
9.2.2.40 Number of UL Symbols IE Semantics: Number of consecutive UL symbols in the end of the slot identified by Slot Index. If extended cyclic prefix is used, the maximum value is 11.
9.2.2.11 Measurement Timing Configuration IE Semantics: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the served cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [10].
9.2.2.28 Connectivity Support - Section Description: The Connectivity Support IE is used to indicate the connectivity supported by a NR cell.

9.2.2.11 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 38.331 [8]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE are provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node2, the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall include in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.

9.2.2.19 Supported SUL band Item IE Semantics: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.

9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Info - Section Description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD or for SUL carrier.

9.2.2.19 NR ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

9.2.2.18 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE contains information about the SUL carrier. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node2, the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall include in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.

9.2.2.18 SUL Frequency Info IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.2.20 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.2.20 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

9.1.3.2 List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE Semantics: Contains a list of cells served by the ng-eNB. If a partial list of cells is signalled, it contains at least one cell per carrier configured at the gNB 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation The List of Served Cells NR IE and the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE, if contained in the XN SETUP REQUEST message, shall contain a complete list of cells served by NG-RAN node1 or, if supported, a partial list of served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE. The List of Served Cells NR IE and the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE, if contained in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message, shall contain a complete list of cells served by NG-RAN node2 or, if supported, a partial list of served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE. If the Partial List Indicator NR IE or the Partial List Indicator NR IE is set to "partial" in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message from the candidate NG-RAN node2, the NG-RAN node1 shall, if supported, assume that the List of Served Cells NR IE or the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message includes a partial list of cells.
