9.2.2.12 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.2.29 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
9.2.2.29 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.2.29 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.2.29 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.2.29 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.2.29 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all “1”s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value “0” indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value “1” indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value “1” corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.2.29 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.2.29 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

9.2.2.14 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

9.2.3.3 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

9.1.3.2 AMF Region Information IE Semantics: Contains a list of all the AMF Regions to which the NG-RAN node belongs. 9.2.3.83 AMF Region Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the Global AMF Region IDs of the AMF Regions to which the NG-RAN node belongs. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation The AMF Region Information IE in the XN SETUP REQUEST message shall contain a complete list of Global AMF Region IDs to which the NG-RAN node1 belongs. The AMF Region Information IE in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message shall contain a complete list of Global AMF Region IDs to which the NG-RAN node2 belongs.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.2.39 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the XnAP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an Xn-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation In case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared Xn-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 38.300 [9], the XN SETUP REQUEST message and the XN SETUP RESPONSE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.

9.2.3.96 TNL Configuration Info - Section Description: This IE is used for signalling IP addresses of IPSEc endpoints used for establishment of IPSec tunnels. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the TNL Configuration Info IE is contained in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message, the NG-RAN node1 shall, if supported, take this IE into account for IPSec establishment.
│  ├─Extended UP Transport Layer Addresses To Add List
│  │  └─Extended UP Transport Layer Addresses To Add Item

9.2.3.96 IP-Sec Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
│  │     └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add List
│  │        └─GTP Transport Layer  Addresses To Add Item
9.2.3.96 GTP Transport Layer Address Info IE Semantics: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.
│  └─Extended UP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove List
│     └─Extended UP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove Item

9.2.3.96 IP-Sec Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
│        └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove List
│           └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove Item
9.2.3.96 GTP Transport Layer Address Info IE Semantics: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.

9.1.3.2 Partial List Indicator NR IE Semantics: Value “partial” indicates that a partial list of cells is included in the List of Served Cells NR IE. 9.2.2.46 Partial List Indicator - Section Description: The Partial List Indicator IE is used by the NG-RAN node to indicate whether the served cell information contained in the same message is a partial list. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the Partial List Indicator NR IE or the Partial List Indicator NR IE is set to "partial" in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message from the candidate NG-RAN node2, the NG-RAN node1 shall, if supported, assume that the List of Served Cells NR IE or the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message includes a partial list of cells.

9.1.3.2 Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE Semantics: Contains NR cell related assistance information. 9.2.2.41 Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR - Section Description: The Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about NR cells and it includes information about cell list size capacity. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE or the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE is present in the XN SETUP REQUEST message the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall, if supported, use it when generating the list of NG-RAN served cell information to include in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message. If the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE or the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE is present in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message from the candidate NG-RAN node2, the NG-RAN node1 shall, if supported, store the collected information to be used for future NG-RAN node interface management.
9.2.2.44 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given cell list.
9.2.2.17 Cell Assistance Information NR - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about NR cells.
9.2.2.17 List of Requested NR Cells IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests a limited list of served NR cells.
9.2.2.17 NR CGI IE Semantics: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.17 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests the complete list of served cells for a gNB

9.1.3.2 Partial List Indicator E-UTRA IE Semantics: Value “partial” indicates that a partial list of cells is included in the List of Served Cells E-UTRA. 9.2.2.46 Partial List Indicator - Section Description: The Partial List Indicator IE is used by the NG-RAN node to indicate whether the served cell information contained in the same message is a partial list.

9.1.3.2 Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE Semantics: Contains E-UTRA cell related assistance information. 9.2.2.43 Cell Assistance Information E-UTRA - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about E-UTRA cells. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.2 Successful Operation If the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE or the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE is present in the XN SETUP REQUEST message the candidate NG-RAN node2 shall, if supported, use it when generating the list of NG-RAN served cell information to include in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message. If the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information NR IE or the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information E-UTRA IE is present in the XN SETUP RESPONSE message from the candidate NG-RAN node2, the NG-RAN node1 shall, if supported, store the collected information to be used for future NG-RAN node interface management.
9.2.2.43 List of Requested E-UTRA Cells IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests a limited list of served E-UTRA cells.

9.2.2.43 E-UTRA CGI IE Semantics: E-UTRA cell for which served E-UTRA cell information is requested. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.43 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests the complete list of served cells for a ng-eNB

section_list.name: XN SETUP FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the neighbouring NG-RAN node to indicate Xn Setup failure.
Direction: NG-RAN node2 --> NG-RAN node1.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.3.2 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)

9.2.3.56 Time To Wait - Section Description: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting times. 8.4.1 Xn Setup 8.4.1.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the XN SETUP FAILURE message includes the Time To Wait IE, the initiating NG-RAN node1 shall wait at least for the indicated time before reinitiating the Xn Setup procedure towards the same NG-RAN node2.

9.2.3.3 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

9.2.2.39 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the XnAP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an Xn-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance.

9.2.2.45 Message Oversize Notification - Section Description: This IE indicates that a failure has occurred due to an excessive message size and it indicates the maximum number of cells that can be received in the List of Served Cells NR IE or in the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE.
9.2.2.44 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given cell list.

section_list.name: NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE
aoa:
This message is sent by a NG-RAN node to a neighbouring NG-RAN node to transfer updated information for an Xn-C interface instance.
Direction: NG-RAN node1 --> NG-RAN node2.
9.2.3.1 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.3.4 TAI Support List IE Semantics: List of supported TAs and associated characteristics. 9.2.3.20 TAI Support List - Section Description: This IE indicates the list of TAIs supported by NG-RAN node and associated characteristics e.g. supported slices. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation If the TAI Support List IE is included in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the receiving node shall replace the previously provided TAI Support List IE by the received TAI Support List IE.
9.2.3.20 TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast TAC 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

9.2.3.20 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMN 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.20 TAI Slice Support List IE Semantics: Supported S-NSSAIs per TA 9.2.3.22 Slice Support List - Section Description: This IE indicates the list of supported slices.
9.2.3.21 S-NSSAI - Section Description: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].
9.2.2.15 Served Cells To Update NR - Section Description: This IE contains updated configuration information for served NR cells exchanged between NG-RAN nodes.

9.2.2.15 Served Cells NR To Add IE Semantics: List of added cells served by the NG-RAN node. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information NR: - If Served Cells NR To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - If Served Cells NR To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information NR IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells NR To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If Served Cells NR To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE. - If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the NG-RAN node2 should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the NG-RAN node1. The NG-RAN node2 shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same NG-RAN node2.

9.2.2.11 Served Cell Information NR - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbouring NG-RAN node may need for the Xn AP interface. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information NR: - If Served Cells NR To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - If Served Cells NR To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information NR IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells NR To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If Served Cells NR To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE. - If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the NG-RAN node2 should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the NG-RAN node1. The NG-RAN node2 shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same NG-RAN node2.
9.2.2.11 NR-PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.11 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.
9.2.2.11 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Info - Section Description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD or for SUL carrier.

9.2.2.19 NR ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

9.2.2.18 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE contains information about the SUL carrier. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node1, the NG-RAN node1 shall include in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each cell added in the Served NR Cells To Add IE and in the Served NR Cells To Modify IE.

9.2.2.18 SUL Frequency Info IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.2.20 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.2.20 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)

9.2.2.20 NR NRB IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [24]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks “NRB” 11, 18, etc.
9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Band IE Semantics: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node1, the NG-RAN node1 shall include in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each cell added in the Served NR Cells To Add IE and in the Served NR Cells To Modify IE.

9.2.2.19 Supported SUL band Item IE Semantics: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.

9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Info - Section Description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD or for SUL carrier.

9.2.2.19 NR ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

9.2.2.18 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE contains information about the SUL carrier. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node1, the NG-RAN node1 shall include in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each cell added in the Served NR Cells To Add IE and in the Served NR Cells To Modify IE.

9.2.2.18 SUL Frequency Info IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.2.20 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.2.20 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)

9.2.2.20 NR NRB IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [24]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks “NRB” 11, 18, etc.
9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Band IE Semantics: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node1, the NG-RAN node1 shall include in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each cell added in the Served NR Cells To Add IE and in the Served NR Cells To Modify IE.

9.2.2.19 Supported SUL band Item IE Semantics: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.
9.2.2.20 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.2.20 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)

9.2.2.40 Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR - Section Description: This IE contains the subcarrier spacing, cyclic prefix and TDD DL-UL slot configuration of an NR cell that a neighbour NG-RAN node needs to take into account for cross-link interference mitigation, when operating its own cells. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information NR: - If Served Cells NR To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - If Served Cells NR To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information NR IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells NR To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If Served Cells NR To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE. - If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the NG-RAN node2 should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the NG-RAN node1. The NG-RAN node2 shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same NG-RAN node2.
9.2.2.40 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].
9.2.2.40 NR Cyclic Prefix IE Semantics: The type of cyclic prefix, which determines the number of symbols in a slot.

9.2.2.40 NR DL-UL Transmission Periodicity IE Semantics: The periodicity is expressed in the format msXpYZ, and equals X.YZ milliseconds.
9.2.2.40 Number of DL Symbols IE Semantics: Number of consecutive DL symbols at the beginning of the slot identified by Slot Index. If extended cyclic prefix is used, the maximum value is 11.
9.2.2.40 Number of UL Symbols IE Semantics: Number of consecutive UL symbols in the end of the slot identified by Slot Index. If extended cyclic prefix is used, the maximum value is 11.

9.2.2.14 Neighbour Information E-UTRA - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of E-UTRA cells that a neighbour NG-RAN node may need to properly operate its own served cells. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information E-UTRA: - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information E-UTRA IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If the Served Cells E-UTRA To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE. - If the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is included into the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE (inside the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE), the receiving gNB should take this into account for cell-level resource coordination with the ng-eNB. The gNB shall consider the received Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same ng-eNB. The protected resource pattern indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is not valid in subframes indicated by the Reserved Subframes IE (contained in E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST messages), as well as in the non-control region of the MBSFN subframes i.e. it is valid only in the control region therein. The size of the control region of MBSFN subframes is indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE.

9.2.2.40 Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR - Section Description: This IE contains the subcarrier spacing, cyclic prefix and TDD DL-UL slot configuration of an NR cell that a neighbour NG-RAN node needs to take into account for cross-link interference mitigation, when operating its own cells. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information NR: - If Served Cells NR To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - If Served Cells NR To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information NR IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells NR To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If Served Cells NR To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE. - If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the NG-RAN node2 should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the NG-RAN node1. The NG-RAN node2 shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same NG-RAN node2.
9.2.2.40 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].
9.2.2.40 NR Cyclic Prefix IE Semantics: The type of cyclic prefix, which determines the number of symbols in a slot.
ENUMERATED (ms0p5, ms0p625, ms1, ms1p25, ms2, ms2p5, ms3, ms4, ms5, ms10, ms20, ms40, ms60, ms80, ms100, ms120, ms140, ms160, …)
9.2.2.40 NR DL-UL Transmission Periodicity IE Semantics: The periodicity is expressed in the format msXpYZ, and equals X.YZ milliseconds.
9.2.2.40 Number of DL Symbols IE Semantics: Number of consecutive DL symbols at the beginning of the slot identified by Slot Index. If extended cyclic prefix is used, the maximum value is 11.
9.2.2.40 Number of UL Symbols IE Semantics: Number of consecutive UL symbols in the end of the slot identified by Slot Index. If extended cyclic prefix is used, the maximum value is 11.
9.2.2.11 Measurement Timing Configuration IE Semantics: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the served cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [10].
9.2.2.28 Connectivity Support - Section Description: The Connectivity Support IE is used to indicate the connectivity supported by a NR cell.

9.2.2.11 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 38.331 [8]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE are provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.
9.2.2.11 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

9.2.2.13 Neighbour Information NR - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour NG-RAN node may need to properly operate its own served cells. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information NR: - If Served Cells NR To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - If Served Cells NR To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information NR IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells NR To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If Served Cells NR To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE. - If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the NG-RAN node2 should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the NG-RAN node1. The NG-RAN node2 shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same NG-RAN node2.
9.2.2.13 NRPCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

9.2.2.14 Neighbour Information E-UTRA - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of E-UTRA cells that a neighbour NG-RAN node may need to properly operate its own served cells. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information E-UTRA: - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information E-UTRA IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If the Served Cells E-UTRA To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE. - If the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is included into the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE (inside the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE), the receiving gNB should take this into account for cell-level resource coordination with the ng-eNB. The gNB shall consider the received Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same ng-eNB. The protected resource pattern indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is not valid in subframes indicated by the Reserved Subframes IE (contained in E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST messages), as well as in the non-control region of the MBSFN subframes i.e. it is valid only in the control region therein. The size of the control region of MBSFN subframes is indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE.
9.2.2.14 E-UTRA PCI IE Semantics: E-UTRA Physical Cell Identifier of the neighbour cell

9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]). 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information E-UTRA: - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information E-UTRA IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If the Served Cells E-UTRA To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE. - If the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is included into the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE (inside the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE), the receiving gNB should take this into account for cell-level resource coordination with the ng-eNB. The gNB shall consider the received Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same ng-eNB. The protected resource pattern indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is not valid in subframes indicated by the Reserved Subframes IE (contained in E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST messages), as well as in the non-control region of the MBSFN subframes i.e. it is valid only in the control region therein. The size of the control region of MBSFN subframes is indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

9.2.2.14 EARFCN IE Semantics: DL EARFCN for FDD or EARFCN for TDD 9.2.2.21 E-UTRA ARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in an E-UTRAN cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.2.21 E-UTRA ARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [25].
9.2.2.14 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

9.2.2.15 Deactivation Indication IE Semantics: Indicates that the concerned cell is switched off for energy saving reasons. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information NR: - If Served Cells NR To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - If Served Cells NR To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information NR IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells NR To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If Served Cells NR To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE. - If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the NG-RAN node2 should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the NG-RAN node1. The NG-RAN node2 shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same NG-RAN node2. Update of Served Cell Information E-UTRA: - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information E-UTRA IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If the Served Cells E-UTRA To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE. - If the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is included into the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE (inside the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE), the receiving gNB should take this into account for cell-level resource coordination with the ng-eNB. The gNB shall consider the received Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same ng-eNB. The protected resource pattern indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is not valid in subframes indicated by the Reserved Subframes IE (contained in E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST messages), as well as in the non-control region of the MBSFN subframes i.e. it is valid only in the control region therein. The size of the control region of MBSFN subframes is indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE.
9.2.2.15 Served Cells To Delete NR IE Semantics: List of deleted cells served by the NG-RAN node.

9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]). 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information NR: - If Served Cells NR To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - If Served Cells NR To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information NR IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells NR To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If Served Cells NR To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE. - If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the NG-RAN node2 should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the NG-RAN node1. The NG-RAN node2 shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same NG-RAN node2.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.2.17 Cell Assistance Information NR - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the NG-RAN node to request information about NR cells.
9.2.2.17 List of Requested NR Cells IE Semantics: Included when the NG-RAN node requests a limited list of served NR cells.
9.2.2.17 NR CGI IE Semantics: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested. 9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. 9.2.2.16 Served Cells To Add E-UTRA IE Semantics: List of added cells served by the NG-RAN node.

Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.2.12 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.
9.2.2.12 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs NOTE: In this version of the specification, it is possible to broadcast only up to 6 PLMN IDs.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.2.12 UL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NUL in TS 36.104 [25] for E-UTRA operating bands for which it is defined; ignored for E-UTRA operating bands for which NUL is not defined 9.2.2.21 E-UTRA ARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in an E-UTRAN cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.2.21 E-UTRA ARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [25].

9.2.2.12 DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL in TS 36.104 [25] 9.2.2.21 E-UTRA ARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in an E-UTRAN cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.2.21 E-UTRA ARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [25].

The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

9.2.2.12 Subframe Assignment IE Semantics: Uplink-downlink subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [26]
9.2.2.12 Special Subframe Info IE Semantics: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [26]
ENUMERATED (ssp0, ssp1, ssp2, ssp3, ssp4, ssp5, ssp6, ssp7, ssp8, ssp9, ssp10, ...)

9.2.2.23 Number of Antenna Ports E-UTRA - Section Description: The Number of Antenna Ports E-UTRA IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports supported by an E-UTRA cell. 9.2.2.23 Number of Antenna Ports IE Semantics: an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports
9.2.2.25 E-UTRA PRACH Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates the E-UTRA PRACH resources used in an E-UTRA neighbour cell.
9.2.2.25 RootSequenceIndex IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [26]
9.2.2.25 ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [26]
9.2.2.25 HighSpeedFlag IE Semantics: "true" corresponds to Restricted set and "false" to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [26]
9.2.2.25 PRACH-FrequencyOffset IE Semantics: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [26]

9.2.2.25 - PRACH-ConfigurationIndex IE - ifTDD: This IE shall be present if the EUTRA-Mode-Info IE in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE is set to the value "TDD". 9.2.2.25 PRACH-ConfigurationIndex IE Semantics: See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [26]
9.2.2.12 MBSFN Subframe Info IE Semantics: MBSFN subframe defined in TS 36.331 [14]
ENUMERATED (n1, n2, n4, n8, n16, n32, …)

9.2.2.26 MBSFN Subframe Allocation E-UTRA - Section Description: The MBSFN Subframe Allocation E-UTRA IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as specified for the MBSFN-SubframeConfig IE TS 36.331 [14].

9.2.2.24 E-UTRA Multiband Info List - Section Description: The E-UTRA Multiband Info List IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that an E-UTRA cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference and corresponds to the MultiBandInfoList specified in TS 36.331 [14].
9.2.2.24 Frequency Band Indicator IE Semantics: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [27, table 5.5-1]

9.2.2.12 FreqBandIndicatorPriority IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the eNodeB supports FreqBandIndicationPriority, and whether FreqBandIndicatorPriority is broadcast in SIB 1 (see TS 36.331 [14])
9.2.2.12 BandwidthReducedSI IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the SystemInformationBlockType1-BR is scheduled in the cell (see TS 36.331 [14])

9.2.2.12 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.2.29 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information E-UTRA: - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information E-UTRA IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If the Served Cells E-UTRA To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE. - If the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is included into the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE (inside the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE), the receiving gNB should take this into account for cell-level resource coordination with the ng-eNB. The gNB shall consider the received Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same ng-eNB. The protected resource pattern indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is not valid in subframes indicated by the Reserved Subframes IE (contained in E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST messages), as well as in the non-control region of the MBSFN subframes i.e. it is valid only in the control region therein. The size of the control region of MBSFN subframes is indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE.
9.2.2.29 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.2.29 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.2.29 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.2.29 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.2.29 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all “1”s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value “0” indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value “1” indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.2.29 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value “1” corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.2.29 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.2.29 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

9.2.2.12 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List E-UTRA IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the cellAccessRelatedInfoList-5GC IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 36.331 [14]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE are provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.
9.2.2.12 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

9.2.2.13 Neighbour Information NR - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour NG-RAN node may need to properly operate its own served cells. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information NR: - If Served Cells NR To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - If Served Cells NR To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information NR IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information NR IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells NR To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If Served Cells NR To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE. - If the Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, the NG-RAN node2 should take this information into account for cross-link interference management with the NG-RAN node1. The NG-RAN node2 shall consider the received Intended TDD DL-UL Configuration NR IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same NG-RAN node2.
9.2.2.13 NRPCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.13 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

9.2.2.19 NR Frequency Info - Section Description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD or for SUL carrier.

9.2.2.19 NR ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

9.2.2.18 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE contains information about the SUL carrier. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the NG-RAN node1, the NG-RAN node1 shall include in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each cell added in the Served NR Cells To Add IE and in the Served NR Cells To Modify IE.

9.2.2.18 SUL Frequency Info IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [24] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.2.20 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate either the UL or the DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.2.20 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [24].

9.2.2.14 Neighbour Information E-UTRA - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of E-UTRA cells that a neighbour NG-RAN node may need to properly operate its own served cells. 8.4.2 NG-RAN node Configuration Update 8.4.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served Cell Information E-UTRA: - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Add IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall add cell information according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - If Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall modify information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE according to the information in the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE. - When either served cell information or neighbour information of an existing served cell in NG-RAN node1 need to be updated, the whole list of neighbouring cells, if any, shall be contained in the Neighbour Information E-UTRA IE. The NG-RAN node2 shall overwrite the served cell information and the whole list of neighbour cell information for the affected served cell. - If the Deactivation Indication IE is contained in the Served Cells E-UTRA To Modify IE, it indicates that the concerned cell was switched off to lower energy consumption. - If the Served Cells E-UTRA To Delete IE is contained in the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, NG-RAN node2 shall delete information of cell indicated by Old ECGI IE. - If the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is included into the NG-RAN NODE CONFIGURATION UPDATE (inside the Served Cell Information E-UTRA IE), the receiving gNB should take this into account for cell-level resource coordination with the ng-eNB. The gNB shall consider the received Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same ng-eNB. The protected resource pattern indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE is not valid in subframes indicated by the Reserved Subframes IE (contained in E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST messages), as well as in the non-control region of the MBSFN subframes i.e. it is valid only in the control region therein. The size of the control region of MBSFN subframes is indicated in the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE.
