section_list.name: Maximum Cell List Size
aoa: 9.2.2.44 Maximum Cell List Size IE Semantics: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given cell list.

section_list.name: Message Oversize Notification
aoa: This IE indicates that a failure has occurred due to an excessive message size and it indicates the maximum number of cells that can be received in the List of Served Cells NR IE or in the List of Served Cells E-UTRA IE.
9.2.2.44 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given cell list.

section_list.name: Partial List Indicator
aoa: 9.2.2.46 Partial List Indicator IE Semantics: The Partial List Indicator IE is used by the NG-RAN node to indicate whether the served cell information contained in the same message is a partial list.

section_list.name: Message Type
aoa: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

section_list.name: Cause
aoa: 9.2.3.2 CHOICE Cause Group IE Semantics: The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the XnAP protocol.

ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Set ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice (s), UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, CP Integrity Protection Failure, UP Integrity Protection Failure, Slice (s) not supported by NG-RAN, MN Mobility, SN Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, PDCP Overload, DRB ID not available, Unspecified, …, UE Context ID not known, Non-relocation of context)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)

section_list.name: Criticality Diagnostics
aoa: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.3.3 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.3.3 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.3.3 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.3.3 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" is not applicable.
9.2.3.3 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: Bit Rate
aoa: 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. The unit is: bit/s

section_list.name: QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters
aoa: This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be applied to a QoS flow.
9.2.3.8 Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines QoS characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.
9.2.3.8 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

9.2.3.8 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.8 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.8 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.9 Dynamic 5QI Descriptor - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.9 Priority Level IE Semantics: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level - Section Description: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

9.2.3.9 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.12 Packet Delay Budget IE Semantics: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.
9.2.3.9 Packet Error Rate IE Semantics: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.13 Packet Error Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for a QoS flow.
9.2.3.13 Scalar IE Semantics: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.
9.2.3.9 5QI IE Semantics: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Delay Critical IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Delay Critical IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.9 - Averaging Window IE - ifGBRflow: This IE shall be present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.2.3.9 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window - Section Description: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: Unit: ms.

9.2.3.9 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and is be ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume - Section Description: This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst Volume for a QoS flow and applies to delay critical GBR QoS flows only. 9.2.3.15 Maximum Data Burst Volume IE Semantics: Unit: byte,
9.2.3.7 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN resource.

9.2.3.7 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. NOTE: The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.7 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. NOTE: Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

9.2.3.5 GBR QoS Flow Information IE Semantics: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS flows and is ignored otherwise. 9.2.3.6 GBR QoS Flow Information - Section Description: This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.6 Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
9.2.3.6 Notification Control IE Semantics: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.3.6 Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.
9.2.3.5 Reflective QoS Attribute IE Semantics: Reflective QoS is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE applies to Non-GBR bearers only and is ignored otherwise.

9.2.3.5 Additional QoS flow Information IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "more likely", this indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of Non-GBR flows only and is ignored otherwise.
9.2.3.5 QoS Monitoring Request IE Semantics: Indicates to measure UL, or DL, or both UL/DL delays for the associated QoS flow.

section_list.name: Packet Loss Rate
aoa: 9.2.3.11 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS flow. Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

aoa: 9.2.3.14 Averaging Window IE Semantics: This IE indicates the Averaging Window for a QoS flow and applies to GBR QoS flows only. Unit: ms.

section_list.name: NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
aoa: 9.2.3.16 NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID IE Semantics: The NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the NG-RAN node. The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401 [2]. NOTE: If Xn-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with the corresponding Xn-C interface instance.

section_list.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
aoa: 9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and a subscription parameter provided by the AMF to the NG-RAN. Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.3.17 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

section_list.name: PDU Session ID
aoa: 9.2.3.18 PDU Session ID IE Semantics: This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

section_list.name: PDU Session Type
aoa: 9.2.3.19 PDU Session Type IE Semantics: This IE defines the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

section_list.name: TAI Support List
aoa: 9.2.3.20 TAI Support Item IE Semantics: This IE indicates the list of TAIs supported by NG-RAN node and associated characteristics e.g. supported slices.
9.2.3.20 TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast TAC 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

9.2.3.20 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMN 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.20 TAI Slice Support List IE Semantics: Supported S-NSSAIs per TA 9.2.3.22 Slice Support List - Section Description: This IE indicates the list of supported slices.
9.2.3.21 S-NSSAI - Section Description: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

section_list.name: S-NSSAI
aoa: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

section_list.name: Slice Support List
aoa: 9.2.3.22 Slice Support Item IE Semantics: This IE indicates the list of supported slices.
9.2.3.21 S-NSSAI - Section Description: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

section_list.name: Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority
aoa: 9.2.3.23 Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE Semantics: The Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE is used to define local configuration for RRM strategies such as camp priorities and control of inter-RAT/inter-frequency mobility in RRC_CONNECTED, as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

section_list.name: GUAMI
aoa: This IE contains the Globally Unique AMF Identifier (GUAMI) as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: Target Cell Global ID
aoa: 9.2.3.25 CHOICE Target Cell IE Semantics: This IE contains either an NR CGI or an E-UTRA CGI.
9.2.2.7 NR CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.7 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA CGI - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.8 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

section_list.name: AMF UE NGAP ID
aoa: 9.2.3.26 AMF UE NGAP ID IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 38.413 [5] and used to uniquely identify the UE association over the source side NG interface instance.

section_list.name: SCG Configuration Query
aoa: 9.2.3.27 SCG Configuration Query IE Semantics: The SCG Configuration Query IE is used to request the S-NG-RAN node to provide current SCG configuration.

section_list.name: RLC Mode
aoa: 9.2.3.28 RLC Mode IE Semantics: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for a DRB.

section_list.name: Transport Layer Address
aoa: 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.

section_list.name: UP Transport Layer Information
aoa: 9.2.3.30 CHOICE UP Transport Layer Information IE Semantics: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

section_list.name: CP Transport Layer Information
aoa: 9.2.3.31 CHOICE CP Transport Layer Information IE Semantics: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn control plane transport.
9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.

section_list.name: Masked IMEISV
aoa: 9.2.3.32 Masked IMEISV IE Semantics: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment. Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [22] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1.

section_list.name: DRB ID
aoa: 9.2.3.33 DRB ID IE Semantics: This IE contains the DRB ID.

section_list.name: DL Forwarding
aoa: 9.2.3.34 DL Forwarding IE Semantics: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of downlink packets.

section_list.name: Data Forwarding Accepted
aoa: 9.2.3.35 Data Forwarding Accepted IE Semantics: This element indicates that data forwarding was accepted.

section_list.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12
aoa: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12
This information element indicates the 12-bit long PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bits long Hyper Frame Number.

section_list.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
aoa: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
This information element indicates the 18-bit long PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 14 bits long Hyper Frame Number.

section_list.name: RAN Paging Area
aoa: The RAN Paging Area IE defines the paging area within a PLMN for RAN paging a UE in RRC_INACTIVE state.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.38 NG-RAN Cell Identity IE Semantics: In this version of the specification, the RAN paging area should contain NG-RAN cells of the same RAT type. 9.2.2.9 NG-RAN Cell Identity - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.
9.2.2.9 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.9 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.8).
9.2.3.39 RAN Area ID - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area ID.
9.2.3.39 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

section_list.name: RAN Area ID
aoa: This IE defines the RAN Area ID.
9.2.3.39 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.2.6 RAN Area Code - Section Description: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

section_list.name: UE Context ID
aoa: 9.2.3.40 CHOICE UE Context ID IE Semantics: This IE is used to address a UE Context within an NG-RAN node.

9.2.3.40 I-RNTI IE Semantics: NOTE: How the new NG-RAN node is able to resolve the old NG-RAN ID from the I-RNTI is a matter of proper configuration in the old and new NG-RAN node. 9.2.3.46 I-RNTI - Section Description: The I-RNTI is defined for allocation in an NR or E-UTRA serving cell as a reference to a UE Context within an NG-RAN node. The I-RNTI is partitioned into two parts, the first part identifies the NG-RAN node that allocated the I-RNTI and the second part identifies the UE context stored in this NG-RAN node.

9.2.3.46 I-RNTI full IE Semantics: This IE is used to identify the suspended UE context of a UE in RRC_INACTIVE using 40 bits (refer to I-RNTI-Value IE in TS 38.331 [10] and I-RNTI IE in TS 36.331 [14]).

9.2.3.46 I-RNTI short IE Semantics: This IE is used to identify the suspended UE context of a UE in RRC_INACTIVE using 24 bits (refer to ShortI-RNTI-Value IE in TS 38.331 [10] and ShortI-RNTI IE in TS 36.331 [14]).

9.2.3.40 Allocated C-RNTI IE Semantics: Temporary C-RNTI allocated to the UE by the cell where the RRC connection has been requested to be resumed, contained in the MAC RAR as defined in TS 38.321 [35] or in TS 36.321 [36].

9.2.3.40 Access PCI IE Semantics: The cell PCI where the RRC connection has been requested to be resumed. 9.2.2.10 NG-RAN Cell PCI - Section Description: This IE defines physical cell ID of a cell served by an NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.10 NR PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.2.10 E-UTRA PCI IE Semantics: E-UTRA Physical Cell ID
9.2.3.40 C-RNTI IE Semantics: C-RNTI contained in the RRCReestablishmentRequest message (TS 38.331 [10]) or RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message (TS 36.331 [14]).
9.2.2.10 NG-RAN Cell PCI - Section Description: This IE defines physical cell ID of a cell served by an NG-RAN node.
9.2.2.10 NR PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.2.10 E-UTRA PCI IE Semantics: E-UTRA Physical Cell ID

section_list.name: Assistance Data for RAN Paging
aoa: This IE provides assistance information for RAN paging.
9.2.3.42 RAN Paging Attempt Information - Section Description: This IE includes information related to the RAN paging attempt over Xn.
9.2.3.42 Paging Attempt Count IE Semantics: Number of the RAN paging attempt.
9.2.3.42 Intended Number of Paging Attempts IE Semantics: Intended number of RAN paging attempts.
9.2.3.42 Next Paging Area Scope IE Semantics: Indicates whether the RAN paging area scope will change at next RAN paging attempt.

aoa: This IE includes information related to the RAN paging attempt over Xn.

9.2.3.42 Intended Number of Paging Attempts IE Semantics: Intended number of RAN paging attempts.

section_list.name: UE RAN Paging Identity
aoa: 9.2.3.43 CHOICE UE RAN Paging Identity IE Semantics: The IE defines the UE Identity for RAN paging a UE in RRC_INACTIVE.

section_list.name: Paging Priority
aoa: ENUMERATED (PrioLevel1, PrioLevel2, PrioLevel3, PrioLevel4, PrioLevel5, PrioLevel6, PrioLevel7, PrioLevel8, ...)
9.2.3.44 Paging Priority IE Semantics: This information element contains an indication of the priority to be considered for the paging request. Lower value codepoint indicates higher priority.

section_list.name: Delivery Status
aoa: 9.2.3.45 Delivery Status IE Semantics: This IE provides the delivery status of RRC PDUs provided by RRC Transfer message. Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP SN, as defined in TS 38.323 [11].

The I-RNTI is partitioned into two parts, the first part identifies the NG-RAN node that allocated the I-RNTI and the second part identifies the UE context stored in this NG-RAN node.

9.2.3.46 I-RNTI full IE Semantics: This IE is used to identify the suspended UE context of a UE in RRC_INACTIVE using 40 bits (refer to I-RNTI-Value IE in TS 38.331 [10] and I-RNTI IE in TS 36.331 [14]).

9.2.3.46 I-RNTI short IE Semantics: This IE is used to identify the suspended UE context of a UE in RRC_INACTIVE using 24 bits (refer to ShortI-RNTI-Value IE in TS 38.331 [10] and ShortI-RNTI IE in TS 36.331 [14]).

Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.2 Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Short Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.
9.2.2.2 Long Macro ng-eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

section_list.name: UE Security Capabilities
aoa: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE.

9.2.3.49 NR Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, “first bit” – 128-NEA1, “second bit” – 128-NEA2, “third bit” – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

9.2.3.49 NR Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, “first bit” – 128-NIA1, “second bit” – 128-NIA2, “third bit” – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

9.2.3.49 E-UTRA Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0, “first bit” – 128-EEA1, “second bit” – 128-EEA2, “third bit” – 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

9.2.3.49 E-UTRA Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0, “first bit” – 128-EIA1, “second bit” – 128-EIA2, “third bit” – 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

section_list.name: AS Security Information
aoa: The AS Security Information IE is used to generate the key material to be used for AS security with the UE.
9.2.3.50 Key NG-RAN Star IE Semantics: KNG-RAN* defined in TS 33.501 [28].
9.2.3.50 Next Hop Chaining Count IE Semantics: Next Hop Chaining Count (NCC) defined in TS 33.501 [28]

section_list.name: S-NG-RAN node Security Key
aoa: 9.2.3.51 S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE Semantics: The S-NG-RAN node Security Key IE is used to apply security in the S-NG-RAN node as defined in TS 33.501 [28]. The S-KSN which is provided by the M-NG-RAN node, see TS 33.501 [28].

section_list.name: Security Indication
aoa: This IE contains the user plane integrity protection indication and confidentiality protection indication which indicates the requirements on UP integrity protection and ciphering for the corresponding PDU session, respectively. Additionally, this IE contains the maximum integrity protected data rate values (UL and DL) per UE for integrity protected DRBs.
9.2.3.52 Integrity Protection Indication IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.
9.2.3.52 Confidentiality Protection Indication IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

9.2.3.52 - Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE - ifIntegrityProtectionrequiredorpreferred: This IE shall be present if the Integrity Protection IE within the Security Indication IE is present and set to “required” or “preferred”. 9.2.3.52 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: If present, this IE contains the values received from the CN for the overall UE capability. This IE may be ignored by the SN in the case of dual connectivity. 9.2.3.73 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in UL. If the Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE is absent, this IE applies to both UL and DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in the DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

section_list.name: Mobility Restriction List
aoa: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility actions for which the NR-RAN provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation or for assigning proper RNAs. If the NG-RAN receives the Mobility Restriction List IE, it shall overwrite previously received restriction information. NG-RAN behaviour upon receiving this IE is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.53 Equivalent PLMNs IE Semantics: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of “equivalent PLMNs” as defined in TS 24.501 [30]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the Serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 RAT Restrictions IE Semantics: This IE contains RAT restriction related information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3.53 RAT Restriction Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. This version of the specification does not use bits 3-7, the sending node shall set bits 3-7 to "0", the sender shall ignore bits 3-7.

9.2.3.53 Extended RAT Restriction Information IE Semantics: If this IE is included, the RAT Restriction Information IE is ignored. 9.2.3.99 Extended RAT Restriction Information - Section Description: This element provides RAT restrictions as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.99 Primary RAT Restriction IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 3-7 reserved for future use. The Primary RAT is the RAT used in the access cell, or target cell.
BIT STRING { e-UTRA (0), nR (1), e-UTRA-unlicensed (2), nR-unlicensed (3)} (SIZE (8, …))

9.2.3.99 Secondary RAT Restriction IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 4-7 reserved for future use. A Secondary RAT is a RAT used in any cell serving the UE excluding the PCell.
9.2.3.53 Forbidden Area Information IE Semantics: This IE contains Forbidden Area information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the forbidden TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.3.53 Service Area Information IE Semantics: This IE contains Service Area Restriction information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the allowed TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.
9.2.3.53 TAC IE Semantics: The TAC of the not-allowed TAI. 9.2.2.5 TAC - Section Description: This information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

9.2.3.53 Last E-UTRAN PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Indicates the E-UTRAN PLMN ID from where the UE formerly handed over to 5GS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to EPS. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
├─Core Network Type Restriction for serving PLMN
9.2.3.53 Core Network Type Restriction for serving PLMN IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to EPC for the Serving PLMN as specified in TS 23.501 [7].
└─Core Network Type Restriction for Equivalent PLMNs

9.2.3.53 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Includes any of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which CN Type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [7]. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3.53 Core Network Type Restriction IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to EPC or to 5GC for this PLMN.

section_list.name: Xn Benefit Value
aoa: 9.2.3.54 Xn Benefit Value IE Semantics: The Xn Benefit Value IE indicates the quantified benefit of the signalling connection. Value 1 indicates lowest benefit, and 8 indicates highest benefit.

section_list.name: Trace Activation
aoa: This IE defines parameters related to a trace activation.

9.2.3.97 NG-RAN Trace ID - Section Description: This IE defines the NG-RAN Trace ID. 9.2.3.97 NG-RAN Trace ID IE Semantics: This IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information encoded as in 9.2.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (last 2 octets).

9.2.3.55 Interfaces To Trace IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an NG-RAN node interface: first bit = NG-C, second bit = Xn-C, third bit = Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1: other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.
ENUMERATED (minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, …)
9.2.3.55 Trace Depth IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.422 [23].
9.2.3.55 Trace Collection Entity IP Address IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.422 [23] 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.

section_list.name: Time To Wait
aoa: 9.2.3.56 Time To Wait IE Semantics: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting times.

section_list.name: QoS Flow Notification Control Indication Info
aoa: 9.2.3.57 QoS Flow Notification Indication Info IE Semantics: This IE provides information about QoS flows of a PDU Session Resource for which notification control has been requested.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

section_list.name: Request Reporting Reference ID
aoa: 9.2.3.58 Request Reporting Reference ID IE Semantics: This IE contains the Request Reporting Reference ID and is used for UE presence in Area of Interest reporting as specified in TS 23.502 [13].

section_list.name: User plane traffic activity report
aoa: 9.2.3.59 User plane traffic activity report IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic activity. "re-activated" is only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object

section_list.name: Lower Layer presence status change
aoa: ENUMERATED (release lower layers, re-establish lower layers, ..., suspend lower layers, resume lower layers)

9.2.3.60 Lower Layer presence status change IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate that lower layer resources' presence status shall be changed. If the presence status is set to "release lower layers" or "suspend lower layers", SDAP entities, PDCP entities, Xn-U bearer resources, NG-U bearer resources and UE context information shall be kept. "re-establish lower layers" is only set after "release lower layers" has been indicated. "resume lower layers" shall restore SCG. "resume lower layers" shall be only set after "suspend lower layers" has been indicated.

section_list.name: RRC Resume Cause
aoa: 9.2.3.61 RRC Resume Cause IE Semantics: The purpose of the RRC Resume Cause IE is to indicate to the old NG-RAN node the reason for the RRC Connection Resume as received from the UE in the ResumeCause defined in TS 36.331 [14] and TS 38.331 [10]. In this version of the specification, this is limited to the case of RNA update.

section_list.name: Priority Level
aoa: 9.2.3.62 Priority Level IE Semantics: This IE indicates the Priority Level for a QoS flow. Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

section_list.name: PDCP SN Length
aoa: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer.
9.2.3.63 UL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for UL.
9.2.3.63 DL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size for DL.

section_list.name: UE History Information
aoa: 9.2.3.64 Last Visited Cell List IE Semantics: The UE History Information IE contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in active state prior to the target cell. The overall mechanism is described in TS 36.300 [12]. NOTE: The definition of this IE is aligned with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 38.413 [5]. Most recent information is added to the top of this list
9.2.3.65 Last Visited Cell Information - Section Description: The Last Visited Cell Information may contain cell specific information.
9.2.3.65 Last Visited NG-RAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 38.413 [5].
9.2.3.65 Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].
9.2.3.65 Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 25.413 [32].
9.2.3.65 Last Visited GERAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

section_list.name: Last Visited Cell Information
aoa: 9.2.3.65 CHOICE Last Visited Cell Information IE Semantics: The Last Visited Cell Information may contain cell specific information.
9.2.3.65 Last Visited NG-RAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 38.413 [5].
9.2.3.65 Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].
9.2.3.65 Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 25.413 [32].
9.2.3.65 Last Visited GERAN Cell Information IE Semantics: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

section_list.name: Paging DRX
aoa: 9.2.3.66 Paging DRX IE Semantics: This IE indicates the Paging DRX as defined in TS 38.304 [33] and TS 36.304 [34].

section_list.name: Security Result
aoa: This IE indicates whether the security policy indicated as "preferred" in the Security Indication IE is performed or not.
9.2.3.67 Integrity Protection Result IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP integrity protection is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.
9.2.3.67 Confidentiality Protection Result IE Semantics: Indicates whether UP ciphering is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

section_list.name: UE Context Kept Indicator
aoa: 9.2.3.68 UE Context Kept Indicator IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the UE Context is kept at the S-NG-RAN node in case of an M-NG-RAN node handover without S-NG-RAN node change.

section_list.name: PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
aoa: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: This IE is applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per PDU session which is defined for the downlink and the uplink direction and is provided at the Handover Preparation procedure to the target NG-RAN node and at the Retrieve UE Context procedure to the new NG-RAN node as received by the 5GC, during dual connectivity related procedures to the to the S-NG-RAN node as decided by the M-NG-RAN node, as specified in TS 37.340 [8]. Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.
├─PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
└─PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink

9.2.3.69 PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate. 9.2.3.4 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

section_list.name: LCID
aoa: 9.2.3.70 LCID IE Semantics: This IE uniquely identifies a logical channel ID for the associated DRB. Corresponds to the LogicalChannelIdentity defined in TS 38.331 [10].

section_list.name: Duplication Activation
aoa: 9.2.3.71 Duplication Activation IE Semantics: The Duplication Activation IE indicates the initial status of UL PDCP duplication, i.e., whether UL PDCP Duplication is activated or not.

section_list.name: RRC Config Indication
aoa: 9.2.3.72 RRC Config Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates the type of RRC configuration used at the S-NG-RAN node.

section_list.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
aoa: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in UL. If the Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE is absent, this IE applies to both UL and DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

9.2.3.73 Maximum IP Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Indicates the maximum aggregate rate for integrity protected DRBs supported by the UE in the DL. 9.2.3.89 Maximum IP Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

section_list.name: PDCP Change Indication
aoa: 9.2.3.74 CHOICE PDCP Change Indication IE Semantics: The PDCP Change Indication IE is used for S-NG-RAN node to either initiate the security key update or to request PDCP data recovery in M-NG-RAN node. The PDCP Change Indication IE is also used for M-NG-RAN node to request PDCP data recovery in S-NG-RAN node.
│  └─Indication from S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node
ENUMERATED (S-NG-RAN node key update required, PDCP data recovery required, ...)

9.2.3.74 Indication from S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node IE Semantics: S-NG-RAN node key update required indicates that the security key in S-NG-RAN node needs to be updated. The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the M-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.
└─Indication from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node
9.2.3.74 Indication from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node IE Semantics: The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the S-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.

section_list.name: UL Configuration
aoa: 9.2.3.75 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the corresponding node. Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the corresponding node.

section_list.name: UP Transport Parameters
aoa: 9.2.3.76 UP Transport Parameters IE Semantics: This IE contains Xn-U related information related to a DRB.

9.2.3.30 UP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane transport. In this release it corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

9.2.3.30 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20]. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
9.2.3.30 GTP-TEID IE Semantics: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

9.2.3.76 Cell Group ID IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the CellGroupId as defined in TS 38.331 [10] (0=MCG, 1=SCG). In this version of the specification, values “2” and “3” shall not be set by the sender and ignored by the receiver. For E-UTRA Cell Groups, the same encoding is used as for NR Cell Groups. NOTE: There is no corresponding IE defined in TS 36.331 [14].

section_list.name: Desired Activity Notification Level
aoa: ENUMERATED (None, QoS Flow, PDU session, UE, …)
9.2.3.77 Desired Activity Notification Level IE Semantics: This IE contains information on which level activity notification shall be performed.

section_list.name: Number of DRB IDs
aoa: 9.2.3.78 Number of DRB IDs IE Semantics: This IE indicates the number of DRB IDs.

section_list.name: QoS Flow Mapping Indication
aoa: 9.2.3.79 QoS Flow Mapping Indication IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate whether only the uplink or the downlink of a QoS flow is mapped to a DRB. This IE indicates whether only the uplink or the downlink QoS flow is mapped to the DRB

section_list.name: RLC Status
aoa: 9.2.3.80 Reestablishment Indication IE Semantics: The RLC Status IE indicates about the RLC configuration change included in the container towards the UE. Indicates that following the change of the radio status, the RLC has been re-established.

section_list.name: Expected UE Behaviour
aoa: This IE indicates the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the NG-RAN node in determining the optimum RRC connection time and to help with the RRC_INACTIVE state transition and RNA configuration (e.g. size and shape of the RNA).
9.2.3.82 Expected UE Activity Behaviour - Section Description: This IE indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.82 Expected Activity Period IE Semantics: If set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].
9.2.3.82 Expected Idle Period IE Semantics: If set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

9.2.3.82 Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information IE Semantics: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.
ENUMERATED (sec15, sec30, sec60, sec90, sec120, sec180, long-time, …)

9.2.3.81 Expected HO Interval IE Semantics: Indicates the expected time interval between inter NG-RAN node handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter NG-RAN node handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.
9.2.3.81 Expected UE Mobility IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is expected to be stationary or mobile.
9.2.3.81 Expected UE Moving Trajectory IE Semantics: Indicates the UE's expected geographical movement.

9.2.3.81 Expected UE Moving Trajectory Item IE Semantics: Includes list of visited and non-visited cells, where visited cells are listed in the order the UE visited them with the most recent cell being the first in the list. Non-visited cells are included immediately after the visited cell they are associated with.
9.2.2.27 Global NG-RAN Cell Identity - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).
9.2.2.9 NG-RAN Cell Identity - Section Description: This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA Cell Identity.
9.2.2.9 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).
9.2.2.9 E-UTRA Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.8).

9.2.3.81 Time Stayed in Cell IE Semantics: Included for visited cells and indicates the time a UE stayed in a cell in seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095 seconds, this IE is set to 4095.

section_list.name: Expected UE Activity Behaviour
aoa: This IE indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.82 Expected Activity Period IE Semantics: If set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].
9.2.3.82 Expected Idle Period IE Semantics: If set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

9.2.3.82 Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information IE Semantics: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.

section_list.name: AMF Region Information
aoa: 9.2.3.83 AMF Region Information IE Semantics: This IE indicates the Global AMF Region IDs of the AMF Regions to which the NG-RAN node belongs.

9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: TNL Association Usage
aoa: 9.2.3.84 TNL Association Usage IE Semantics: This IE indicates the usage of the TNL association. Indicates whether the TNL association is only used for UE associated signalling, or non-UE associated signalling, or both.

section_list.name: Network Instance
aoa: 9.2.3.85 Network Instance IE Semantics: This IE provides the network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7].

section_list.name: PDCP Duplication Configuration
aoa: 9.2.3.86 PDCP Duplication Configuration IE Semantics: The PDCP Duplication Configuration IE indicates whether PDCP Duplication is configured or de-configured.

section_list.name: Secondary RAT Usage Information
aoa: This IE provides information on the Secondary RAT resources used by a PDU Session with MR-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [8].
9.2.3.88 Volume Timed Report List - Section Description: This IE provides information on the data usage.

9.2.3.88 Start Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

9.2.3.88 End Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count UL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count DL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.3.10 QoS Flow Identifier - Section Description: This IE identifies a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Identifier is specified in TS 23.501 [7].
9.2.3.88 Volume Timed Report List - Section Description: This IE provides information on the data usage.

9.2.3.88 Start Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

9.2.3.88 End Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count UL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count DL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.

section_list.name: Volume Timed Report List
aoa: 9.2.3.88 Volume Timed Report Item IE Semantics: This IE provides information on the data usage.

9.2.3.88 Start Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

9.2.3.88 End Timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [37]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count UL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.3.88 Usage Count DL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.

section_list.name: Maximum IP Rate
aoa: 9.2.3.89 Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate IE Semantics: This IE indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE as defined in TS 38.300 [9]. Defines the upper bound of the aggregate data rate of user plane integrity protected data.

section_list.name: UL Forwarding
aoa: 9.2.3.90 UL Forwarding IE Semantics: This element indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.

section_list.name: UE Radio Capability for Paging
aoa: This IE contains paging specific UE Radio Capability information.
├─UE Radio Capability for Paging of NR
9.2.3.91 UE Radio Capability for Paging of NR IE Semantics: Includes the RRC UERadioPagingInformation message as defined in TS 38.331 [18].
└─UE Radio Capability for Paging of E-UTRA
9.2.3.91 UE Radio Capability for Paging of E-UTRA IE Semantics: Includes the RRC UERadioPagingInformation message as defined in TS 36.331 [21].

section_list.name: Common Network Instance
aoa: 9.2.3.92 Common Network Instance IE Semantics: This IE provides the common network instance to be used by the NG-RAN node when selecting a particular transport network resource as described in TS 23.501 [7] in a format common with 5GC.

section_list.name: Default DRB Allowed
aoa: 9.2.3.93 Default DRB Allowed IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate whether the SN is allowed to configure the default DRB for a PDU session or not.

section_list.name: Split Session Indicator
aoa: 9.2.3.94 Split Session Indicator IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether admitting the requested resources results in a split PDU session.

section_list.name: UL Forwarding Proposal
aoa: 9.2.3.95 UL Forwarding Proposal IE Semantics: This IE indicates a proposal for forwarding of uplink packets.

section_list.name: TNL Configuration Info
aoa: This IE is used for signalling IP addresses of IPSEc endpoints used for establishment of IPSec tunnels.
├─Extended UP Transport Layer Addresses To Add List
│  └─Extended UP Transport Layer Addresses To Add Item

9.2.3.96 IP-Sec Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
│     └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add List
│        └─GTP Transport Layer  Addresses To Add Item
9.2.3.96 GTP Transport Layer Address Info IE Semantics: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.
└─Extended UP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove List
└─Extended UP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove Item

9.2.3.96 IP-Sec Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint. 9.2.3.29 Transport Layer Address - Section Description: This IE is defined to contain an IP address.
└─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove List
└─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove Item
9.2.3.96 GTP Transport Layer Address Info IE Semantics: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.

section_list.name: NG-RAN Trace ID
aoa: 9.2.3.97 NG-RAN Trace ID IE Semantics: This IE defines the NG-RAN Trace ID. This IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information encoded as in 9.2.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (last 2 octets).

section_list.name: Non-GBR Resources Offered
aoa: 9.2.3.98 Non-GBR Resources Offered IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the MCG offers non-GBR resources for non-GBR QoS flows of the PDU Session Resource.

section_list.name: Extended RAT Restriction Information
aoa: This element provides RAT restrictions as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

9.2.3.99 Primary RAT Restriction IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 3-7 reserved for future use. The Primary RAT is the RAT used in the access cell, or target cell.
BIT STRING { e-UTRA (0), nR (1), e-UTRA-unlicensed (2), nR-unlicensed (3)} (SIZE (8, …))

9.2.3.99 Secondary RAT Restriction IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. Bits 4-7 reserved for future use. A Secondary RAT is a RAT used in any cell serving the UE excluding the PCell.

section_list.name: 5GC Mobility Restriction List Container
aoa: 9.2.3.100 5GC Mobility Restriction List Container IE Semantics: This IE contains the Mobility Restriction List IE specified in TS 38.413 [5] as received by the NG-RAN from the 5GC. The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the Mobility Restriction List IE specified in TS 38.413 [5].
